summary: On Sunday, Lahbati and Gutierrez posted photos of Zion on social media as they shared their birthday message to their firstborn.
title: Zion Gutierrez turns 5
story:
MANILA -- Zion Gutierrez, the adorable son of Richard Gutierrez and Sarah Lahbati, has turned five. 
On Sunday, Lahbati and Gutierrez posted photos of Zion on social media as they shared their birthday message to their firstborn. 



 

Happy birthday to my baby, Zion!!! I love you forever with all my heart. ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ #ziontheyounglion #zionturns5
A post shared by  Sarah Lahbati (@sarahlahbati) on Apr 28, 2018 at 9:11pm PDT






 

Happy 5th birthday little man! We Love you! 😊🙏🏼
A post shared by  Richard Gutierrez (@richardgutz) on Apr 29, 2018 at 1:05pm PDT


Gutierrez and Lahbati introduced Zion to the public in 2014 after keeping him secret for more than a year.
The couple also have another son Kai, who was born just last March.

summary: Crooner Richard Poon is set to celebrate his 10th anniversary in the music industry with a special concert "RP10," which will be held on May 18 at the Newport Performing Arts Theater of Resorts World Manila.
title: Richard Poon to mark 10th anniversary with concert
story:
A post shared by Richard Poon (@richardpoonph) on Apr 10, 2018 at 9:26pm PDT



MANILA -- Crooner Richard Poon is set to celebrate his 10th anniversary in the music industry with a special concert "RP10," which will be held on May 18 at the Newport Performing Arts Theater of Resorts World Manila.
Poon made the announcement on Monday on "It's Showtime," where he opened the show with Yeng Constantino.
Joining Poon's concert as guest artists are Richard Yap, Kean Cipriano, Sitti, Nyoy Volante, Erik Santos and Christian Bautista. He will be backed up by 21-man big band orchestra.
"RP10" will be directed by John Prats.

summary: Nearly three months after celebrating their seventh wedding anniversary, actress Kristine Hermosa once again reminded husband Oyo Sotto just how much she loves him.
title: LOOK: Kristine Hermosa shares sweet message for husband Oyo
story:
MANILA -- Nearly three months after celebrating their seventh wedding anniversary, actress Kristine Hermosa once again reminded husband Oyo Sotto just how much she loves him.
The actress, who is in Siargao for the birthday celebration of her father-in-law Vic Sotto, turned sentimental as she pondered on marriage.



 

A post shared by Kristine Hermosa-Sotto (@khsotto) on Apr 29, 2018 at 4:27pm PDT


"Every day we are given a chance to live our life choosing what matters the most. I choose God, I choose love. Today, I choose you once again... and that's how I want to live the rest of my days," she wrote as she thanked God for His "unlimited love and grace." 
Just recently, Hermosa posted a quote also on marriage: "A strong marriage requires two people who choose to love each other even on those days when they struggle to like each other."
Sotto and Hermosa tied the knot in Batangas on January 12, 2011. They have four children.

story:

MANILA -- Hindi nagpakabog si K Brosas sa kanyang 18th anniversary concert na "18K" na naganap noong Sabado, Abril 28, sa Kia Theater.
 
Opening number pa lang, pak at isang malaking check na kaagad ang isinalubong ng audience sa "Gold" at "Run the World" song-and-dance production number ni K. 
Unang bisita ang kanyang anak na si Crystal Brosas na ipinakitang may talento rin sa pagpe-perform. 
Next level din ang comedy segments kasama ang malalapit na kaibigan na sina Chocoleit at Pooh na napagkatuwaan ang K-Pop culture at generation sa Pilipinas.
Winner din ang pagbirit ni K kasama sina Angeline Quinto at Kyla na gaya niya ay nagsimula rin sa amateur singing contest. 
Napanganga naman ang lahat sa kakaibang divas prod ni K kasama si Zsa Zsa Padilla, Jaya at Regine Velasquez sa buwis buhay na duet.
Kung may komedya, seryoso naman si K sa kanyang "Warrior is A Child" number na malapit sa puso niya. Dito ibinahagi ni K ang ilang personal na mga pinagdadaanan sa buhay at adbokasiya.
Isang malaking pagbati kay K Brosas sa kanyang 18 taong makukulay at makahulugang showbiz career.

summary: Former "Pinoy Big Brother" housemates Mickey Perz and Gee-Ann Abrahan are expecting a baby girl.
title: Ex 'PBB' housemates Gee-Ann, Mickey expecting baby girl
story:
MANILA -- Former "Pinoy Big Brother" housemates Mickey Perz and Gee-Ann Abrahan are expecting a baby girl.
The couple made the announcement during a gender-reveal party over the weekend in Quezon City.
Photos and video clips of the party, which was attended by the the couple's family and friends, have been uploaded on social media.



 

A post shared by Saicy Aguila (@sexysaicy12) on Apr 29, 2018 at 4:19am PDT



Abrahan, who confirmed her pregnancy just weeks ago, is expected to give birth this June. 
In a previous interview, Abrahan said it took them a while to reveal that they are expecting a baby due to trauma after she suffered miscarriage in 2016.
"I had a miscarriage in the same year we got married in 2016. So since then, parang praning pa ako. Ayoko muna i-announce. Siguro ayun, kaya hindi niya pa rin sinasabi to our other friends so I won’t din muna," Abrahan said at the time.

story:

The couple shared their anniversary messages for each other on Instagram.
Torres waxed sentimental as she shared a photo from 1998 while they were on their honeymoon in Switzerland.



 

You are my love song, @richardgomezinstagram.♥️ Cheers to 20 beautiful years, and more! 🥂♥️ 📷 circa 1998, young and in love, in a random photo booth while on honeymoon in Crans Montana, Switzerland. (P.S. I love you more today than yesterday, sweetheart.♥️🎶)

For his part, Gomez described his marriage with Torres as "blissful."



 

20 years of blissful marriage and I still kiss you like the first time I kissed you. #ohhkayanyoyan #tinatawananlangakonilucywhileimtypingthiscaption #hahahahahaha
A post shared by  Richard Gomez 🇵🇭 (@richardgomezinstagram) on Apr 28, 2018 at 5:30am PDT

summary: Ibinahagi ni Coleen ang nararamdaman sa pagkawala ng kanyang mahal na alaga na regalo sa aktres para sa kanyang ikasiyam na kaarawan.
title: Coleen, nawalan ng 'partner' sa mismong araw ng kasal
story:
MANILA -- Isang nakakaantig na kuwento ang ibinahagi ni Coleen Garcia sa pagpanaw ng kanyang alagang aso na si Bambi.



 

A post shared by Coleen Garcia Crawford (@coleen) on Apr 29, 2018 at 3:40am PDT



Sa Instagram nitong Linggo, ibinahagi ni Coleen ang nararamdaman sa pagkawala ng kanyang mahal na alaga na regalo sa aktres para sa kanyang ikasiyam na kaarawan. 
Ayon kay Coleen, itinuring niyang "guardian angel" si Bambi. 
Ani Coleen, noon pa man ay hiniling niya sa kanyang alaga na huwag siyang iwan hanggang sa araw na siya ay ikasal.
"Way before I met (Billy Crawford), I’ve had several scares and thought I was going to lose her, but she proved to be the strongest little baby. I always told her, ever since I was a little girl, to never leave my side until the day I get married," ani Coleen.
Kuwento ni Coleen, mahina na si Bambi ilang araw bago ang kasal niya sa "It's Showtime" host na si Billy Crawford.
Nagpasalamat ang aktres sa alaga bago sabihing handa na siya kung sakaling iiwan na siya nito. 
"On the night before we had to leave for the wedding, I saw how weak she was... It broke my heart. I hugged her and prayed to God, thanking Him for her life and companionship; for using her to remind me that I was never alone, and that someone was always watching over me. I thanked her, too, and I told her for the first time ever that it’s okay for her to rest now... I prayed to God that if it were to happen, I just hoped that it would happen while we weren’t home so that I wouldn’t have to see it," ani Coleen.
Sa araw mismo ng kanyang kasal, Abril 20, natanggap ni Coleen ang balitang pumanaw ang aso.
"On the morning of my wedding, April 20, 2018 at around 8:26 a.m., I woke up to a text from our driver, telling me that Bambi had passed away that same morning. How I felt was unexpected. I was purely filled with joy. I couldn’t even find it in me to be sad because I felt it would make me so greedy. How could I ask for more when God has blessed me with this much? She left me not a day before, not a day after, but waited until the actual DAY of my wedding. How amazing is that? All the tears I shed for Bambi now are never sad; only tears of joy and gratitude at the thought of God ushering me into this new chapter of my life, after all the turbulent times I have had to endure in the past. A clean slate, a new beginning," ani Coleen.
Bisitahin ang Patrol.PH para sa iba pang mga balita.

summary: "Avengers: Infinity War" took in $630 million in its first weekend, the highest global opening of all time, industry estimates showed on Sunday.
title: 'Avengers' opens with $630 million, smashing global record
story:
A scene from 'Avengers: Infinity War'


LOS ANGELES - "Avengers: Infinity War" took in $630 million in its first weekend, the highest global opening of all time, industry estimates showed on Sunday.
"The latest Marvel juggernaut... opened with $630M worldwide, making it the largest global weekend tally in the history of film, and this was done without China," which has a later opening, industry tracker Exhibitor Relations said.
That topped "The Fate of the Furious," the eighth installment of the high-octane action series starring Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez that opened with more than $530 million globally in 2017.
"Infinity War," which features more than two dozen superheroes fighting to save the universe, also broke the record for highest North American opening weekend, raking in $250 million at US and Canadian box offices.

Box office: 'Avengers: Infinity War' closes in on all-time domestic weekend record

That beat "The Force Awakens," the seventh film in the long-running "Star Wars" space saga that made $248 million in its opening weekend in 2015.
SAVING THE UNIVERSE
"Infinity War" is the 19th film in the so-called Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), combining a whopping 9 franchises and a cast list that reads like a who's who of Hollywood's A-list.
Robert Downey Jr dons the red and gold metal suit once again as Iron Man; Benedict Cumberbatch is Doctor Strange; Scarlett Johansson is back as Black Widow; and Australia's Chris Hemsworth is Thor.
Also back for more?
Black Panther -- the Marvel breakout of the year after the standalone pic's massive opening in February -- Captain America, the Hulk, Spider-Man, Hawkeye, the Guardians of the Galaxy and their assorted allies.
Their mission is to prevent the powerful purple alien Thanos (Josh Brolin) from destroying the universe.
"We took a picture of every single person whose character has been in the MCU. We hung it up on a wall all around us," co-director Anthony Russo, who helms the film with his brother Joe, told reporters ahead of its release.
"We basically spent months and months and months talking about where we could go with each character, how we could draw them through the story," he added.
"Every one of these characters... has been on a very specific journey through the MCU to arrive at this moment."
This is the third "Avengers" film, before the final, untitled saga set for next year.
'NORTH STAR'
An important source of inspiration is the Marvel canon -- the storylines developed over decades in the original comic books.
"Infinity War" is drawn from the "Infinity Gauntlet" series of the early 1990s.
"It starts with those comics and us beginning to rip pages out or rip copies of pages out and put them on the walls and start to be inspired," explains Kevin Feige, the president of Marvel Studios, which is owned by Disney.
"It's a North Star for us as we lead these giant productions into reality."
In the movie's trailer, Gamora (Zoe Saldana) -- Thanos's daughter, of sorts -- explains that the villain believes that if he annihilates half of the universe, he can save the other half.
He needs the so-called Infinity Stones to do it. So, the heroes need to keep him from getting them.
The film cost an eye-watering $300 million to make, according to Hollywood media.
"It was about the most fun creative exercise I think I've ever been through in my life," said Anthony Russo. "We thought about everybody in the MCU."

title: Moira's new music video holds a wonderful surprise for fans
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
MANILA -- Moira Dela Torre on Sunday unveiled the music video for her single "Tagpuan," and it ended with a surprise for her and her boyfriend's fans.
The music video, directed by actor John Prats, was aired on "Gandang Gabi Vice."
Dela Torre and Jason Marvin Hernandez also confirmed their engagement, as seen in the last part of the music video.
According to Dela Torre, the video is a glimpse into her life's story.
"Buhay ko talaga. I come from a broken family, and we wanted to incorporate na just because you come from a broken family, doesn't mean your future's going to be broken also," she said.
However, she admitted that the proposal was a surprise.
"That was the story pero hindi ko alam na doon pala siya magpo-propose," Dela Torre added.
Hernandez, for his part, said he talked with Prats and planned the proposal beforehand.
"Akala niya doon sa last part, magtatagpo lang kami. Pero hindi niya alam, nakikipagkuntsaba na ako kay Kuya John while planning the music video," he said.
He also took to social media to announce their engagement.

All my life I’ve been searching for “the one”, not knowing that she’s been my bestfriend all along. I love you forever my @moirarachelle4 🌚🌝❤️💍 pic.twitter.com/02kW5OjhgR

summary: The Avengers assembled in full force at the box office this weekend.
title: Box office: 'Avengers: Infinity War' closes in on all-time domestic weekend record
story:
A scene from 'Avengers: Infinity War'


LOS ANGELES -- The Avengers assembled in full force at the box office this weekend.
"Avengers: Infinity War" took North America by storm, opening with $250 million in 4,474 theaters. While numbers could fluctuate before an official tally comes in on Monday, that would surpass "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" for the biggest domestic opening weekend of all time. "The Force Awakens" bowed with $248 million in 2015.
The superhero tentpole, which cost between $300 million and $400 million, opened worldwide with $630 million, making it the highest global opening weekend of all time, even without China debuting this weekend.
Prior to "Infinity War," the original "Avengers" had the highest opening to date for a Marvel film, debuting with $207.4 million. Its sequel, "Age of Ultron," launched with $191 million. The first movie earned $623 million in North America, while the second made $459 million.
Joe and Anthony Russo directed from a script by Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely. "Infinity War" picks up two years after the events of "Captain America: Civil War" with the Avengers teaming up with the Guardians of the Galaxy to stop the evil Thanos (Josh Brolin) from inter-galactic dominance.
The heroic ensemble cast includes Robert Downey Jr.'s Iron Man, Chris Hemsworth's Thor, Chris Evans' Captain America, Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow, Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther, Chris Pratt's Star Lord, Benedict Cumberbatch's Doctor Strange, and Mark Ruffalo's Hulk.
With no other films opening in the wake of "Infinity War," Paramount Pictures' "A Quiet Place" secured second place with $10.6 million in 3,565 locations. The thriller -- directed by John Krasinski and co-starring Krasinski and Emily Blunt -- continues its impressive run with a domestic total of $148 million in four weeks. Due to the film's monster success, Paramount's head Jim Gianopulos announced a sequel was in the works.
In third place, STX's "I Feel Pretty" scored $8 million from 3,440 theaters in its second weekend. That brings the North American tally on Amy Schumer's latest comedy to $29 million. 
Meanwhile, Dwayne Johnson's "Rampage" dropped down to the fourth slot, earning $7.1 million in 3,508 locations. The Warner Bros. actioner has made $77.9 million domestically in its three weeks of release.
Rounding out the weekend is another Marvel title, "Black Panther." In its 11th weekend, the tentpole made $4.6 million, bringing its domestic total to $688 million. Globally, "Black Panther" has collected $1.3 billion. With "Infinity War's" massive debut, Marvel's 19 titles have collectively grossed $15 billion worldwide.
"Infinity War" has ignited a spark in the box office. Prior to this weekend, the year to date box office was down 2.8 percent. After this weekend, the 2018 box office is up 3.2 percent compared to 2017, according to comScore.
"'Avengers: Infinity War' demonstrated yet another Marvel superhero power," Paul Dergarabedian, an analyst at comScore, said. "The ability to reverse a downtrending box office year with a single knockout punch and literally change the box office fortunes of Hollywood almost overnight."

summary: Vic Sotto turned 64 on Saturday and he celebrated it with no less than the people closest to his heart.
title: LOOK: Vic Sotto celebrates birthday with family in Siargao
story:
MANILA -- Vic Sotto turned 64 on Saturday and he celebrated it with the people closest to his heart.
As seen on Instagram, almost all of Sotto’s children were present in their family vacation in Siargao to mark the special occasion.
With him in the beautiful island were his daughters Danica, Paulina and five-month old Talitha, as well as his son Oyo.
Danica’s husband Marc Pingris, and Oyo’s wife Kristine Hermosa were likewise present.



 

A post shared by Marc Pingris (@jeanmarc15) on Apr 28, 2018 at 8:26pm PDT






 

A post shared by Marie Pauleen Luna- Sotto (@pauleenlunasotto) on Apr 28, 2018 at 11:09pm PDT






 

A post shared by Marie Pauleen Luna- Sotto (@pauleenlunasotto) on Apr 26, 2018 at 10:33pm PDT



And while his other son Vico could not make it, he greeted his father through an Instagram post all the way from the United States. 
Vico said he missed his father’s birthday trip because’s he’s working with the Iowa Public Information Board, “fine-tuning my proposal to make our local government more transparent.”
Of course, his wife Pauleen Luna would not dare miss the occasion.
“7 birthdays together and I’m so grateful for each one! Thank you Lord for giving my husband another healthy year! I couldn’t have asked for a better partner in life! I love you. Happy birthday,” she wrote on Instagram.

summary: Ibinahagi ni Ellen Adarna sa isang Instagram post ang larawan ng tinawag niyang "babies" na kaapelyido ni John Lloyd Cruz.
title: 'Babies' ni Ellen, sunod ang apelyido kay John Lloyd
story:
Ibinahagi ni Ellen Adarna sa isang Instagram post ang larawan ng tinawag niyang "babies."



 

A post shared by Ellen Adarna (@maria.elena.adarna) on Apr 28, 2018 at 1:44am PDT



Sa caption ng picture ng mga tuta, binanggit na ang pangalan nila ay Felicia Marie Cruz at John Ruffus Cruz, sunod sa apelyido ni John Lloyd Cruz na nobyo ni Adarna.
Mapapansin ding nasa pangalan ng mga tuta ang pangalang "John" at "Marie" na maaaring galing sa "Maria" na bahagi ng full name ni Adarna.
Samantala, sa IG stories naman ni Adarna kung saan binati niya ang kaibigang nail artist, mapapansin ang gitnang daliri ni Adarna na tila mayroong engagement ring at wedding band.



Tikom pa rin ang bibig nina Adarna at Cruz ukol sa isyung pagbubuntis ng aktres at ang umugong na balitang planong kasal ng dalawa.
Nito lang weekend, naging usap-usapan kung nanganak na nga ba si Adarna kasunod ng post ng isang kaibigang kino-congratulate siya sa pagiging ina o "motherhood."

Has she given birth? Rumors fly after Ellen is congratulated on 'motherhood'

Kamakailan, lalong uminit ang isyu ng pagbubuntis ni Adarna dahil sa larawan ng kaniya umanong "baby bump."

SPOTTED: Ellen Adarna sports baby bump in HK with John Lloyd Cruz
Is that a baby bump? Ellen Adarna gives fans a glimpse of her tummy

Dati nang sinabi ni Adarna na target niyang magpakasal at magkaanak pagsapit ng edad 30. 
Puwede rin naman daw sa kaniya kahit mauna siyang magkaroon ng anak.
"Gusto kong mag-asawa at magka-anak sa taong mahal ko. Pero parang hindi ko pa alam. Parang malabo pa. Pero for now, kasi hindi ko pa alam and 30 'yung target ko, anak muna na lang," sabi ni Adarna sa isang panayam noong Pebrero 2017. 
"I don't want to get married. Maybe when I'm 40, gusto ko anak muna. And I talked to my parents about it already, and I just have to find a partner na may good genes," aniya noon.

BALIKAN: Ellen Adarna wants a guy with 'good genes' to give her a baby

Nito lang Pebrero, nagpunta pa sa Japan ang magkasintahan kasama ang pamilya ni Adarna.

Ellen Adarna jets to Japan with John Lloyd amid baby rumors


LOOK: John Lloyd bonds with Ellen Adarna's family in Japan

Muli na ring aktibo ang Instagram account ni Adarna matapos niya itong i-deactivate kamakailan.
Pero sa posts ng kaniyang malalapit na kaibigan at kaanak, naka-tag ang sinasabing pribadong IG account ni Adarna na may handle na " @emg.a" at ang tila pribadong account din ni Cruz na "@_idancruz." 
Bisitahin ang Patrol.PH para sa iba pang mga balita.

summary: Ayon kay Anne Curtis, "blown away" o labis siyang humanga sa K-pop group na EXO nang dumalo sa Manila show ng kanilang "Elyxion" tour sa SM Mall of Asia Arena noong Sabado.
title: Anne Curtis, 'blown away' sa concert ng K-pop group EXO
story:
Soooo goood!!!! pic.twitter.com/0DOsOso9fR
— Anne Curtis-Smith (@annecurtissmith) April 28, 2018

Maging ang mga hinahangaan ay humahanga rin, gaya na lang ng local superstar na si Anne Curtis na ipinahayag noong gabi ng Sabado ang kaniyang labis na pagkabilib sa K-pop group na EXO.
Sa Twitter, sinabi ni Curtis na "blown away" siya sa EXO matapos dumalo sa Manila show ng kanilang "Elyxion" tour sa SM Mall of Asia Arena.

Wow. That was awesome. 🙌🏼 Graaaaaaaabe. Almost 3 hours of non-stop dancing and Salute @weareoneEXO 🙌🏼 That concert was 🔥 I was blown away!
— Anne Curtis-Smith (@annecurtissmith) April 28, 2018

Bago magsimula ang concert, ibinahagi pa ng 33 anyos na aktres sa kaniyang Instagram story na mag-isa siyang manonood matapos umanong mag-flake o umurong ng kaniyang mister na si Erwan Heussaff.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Kuwento ni Curtis, ikinatuwa niyang makita sa personal ang EXO member na si Do Kyung-soo, o mas kilala sa stage name na D.O., na una niya aniyang napanood sa K-drama na "It's Okay, That's Love."

When I saw D.O performing medyo shookt kasi last memory of him is in it’s ok that’s love! ❤️ Super happy to see him in person! Tapos si Chanyeol ayieee. Even if I knew wala sa setlist & it’s not an EXO song may katiting akong hopia na beke nemen sa solo nya Stay with me. 😂 pic.twitter.com/AGpjrU0DHF
— Anne Curtis-Smith (@annecurtissmith) April 28, 2018

Ayon kay Curtis, nagsimula siyang makinig sa mga K-pop group bunsod ng pagkahumaling niya sa K-drama, kung saan itinatampok ang mga miyembro bilang bida o mang-aawit sa soundtrack. 
"I research the OST's (original soundtrack) and actors tapos 'yon pala singers din sila. I like listening to a lot of groups and solo artists now," sabi ni Curtis sa tweet.

That’s actually how i’m slowly crossing over to kpop because I research the OST’S and actors tapos un pala singers din sila. I like listening to a lot of groups and solo artists now. ❤️ Pero... Kdrama for life pa rin! Hahaha ❤️
— Anne Curtis-Smith (@annecurtissmith) April 28, 2018

Ayon pa kay Curtis, umasa siyang kakantahin ng miyembrong si Chanyeol ang awiting nitong "Stay With Me," na sumikat sa paboritong K-drama ng aktres na "Goblin."
"Even if I knew wala sa setlist [and] it’s not an EXO song may katiting akong hopia na beke nemen sa solo n'ya 'Stay With Me'," tweet ni Curtis, na sinusundan ng higit 10 milyon sa Twitter.

Anne, Erwan, binisita ang ilang shooting locations ng 'Goblin'

summary: Actress Sharon Cuneta and Senator Francis “Kiko” Pangilinan exchanged sweet messages on social media to mark their 22nd anniversary as a married couple.
title: Sharon, Kiko exchange sweet anniversary messages
story:
Actress Sharon Cuneta and Senator Francis “Kiko” Pangilinan exchanged sweet messages on social media to mark their 22nd anniversary as a married couple.
“Happy 22nd to my sweetheart! Here is to twenty plus plus plus more years of marriage and family life with you and you only,” Pangilinan began.



 

A post shared by Kiko Pangilinan (@kiko.pangilinan) on Apr 28, 2018 at 7:02pm PDT



Describing their marriage as an exhilarating, exciting, at times difficult yet truly meaningful journey, Pangilinan said he wouldn’t think twice of going through all of it again with Cuneta by his side because “I love you dearly, with all my heart and treasure all that we have become.”
Pangilinan ended his message by saying Cuneta will always be his “answered prayer, and a rare and precious gift from up above.”



 

A post shared by Coach:TheVoice.phActorSinger (@reallysharoncuneta) on Apr 27, 2018 at 9:16am PDT



Touched by her husband’s sweet message, Cuneta said their 22 years of marriage hasn’t been easy but she’s happy they are still standing by each other.
“May God bless us and our family always. Thanks, Kikyoo! Love you my Dorkie. Happy 22nd!!!” she wrote.
Pangilinan and Cuneta have two daughters, Frankie and Miel, and a son, Miguel.

summary: It’s not every day that Janella Salvador shares a video of herself with Elmo Magalona during their down time together.
title: This is how Janella greeted Elmo on his birthday
story:
It’s not every day that Janella Salvador shares a video of herself with Elmo Magalona during their down time together.
But Magalona’s birthday is reason enough to show their fans how they are “behind all the glamour,” as Salvador would describe it.



 

A post shared by Janella Salvador 🦄 (@superjanella) on Apr 27, 2018 at 7:02am PDT



“Cheesy as it might sound, it’s true... there’s nothing like finding someone who you can be your complete self with (.....and have your own language with). This is us,” she wrote on Instagram.
“People can say what they want but I will always be thankful because God blessed not just me but the whole world with you and your funny, talented and charming self. Keep doing you. You are one bright star in the vast universe and I will always have your back no matter what,” she added.
Salvador then called herself Magalona’s number one supporter, taking top spot along with his mom Pia Magalona, before greeting him a happy birthday.
Magalona welcomed his birthday with Salvador in Dubai where they are currently at.
The love team checked out many of the city's tourist spots, and even rode a camel together. 
Magalona and Salvador were part of an event dubbed "Fiestahan 2018," an arts show dedicated to Pinoy artists. It was held at the Roda Al Bustan Hotel in Dubai.

summary: The two were seen trying to keep it low key with their outfits.
title: Dating? Khalil Ramos, Gabbi Garcia spotted together in BGC
story:
Gabbi Garcia and Khalil Ramos are fueling dating rumors after being spotted out together this weekend. Instagram


She was left feeling "kilig" after she got to hug "Riverdale" star Cole Sprouse. 
But if rumors are true, actress Gabbi Garcia is probably getting her daily dose of it courtesy of actor Khalil Ramos. 
A Pep report claimed to have spotted the pair out together around Bonifacio Global City in Taguig on Saturday. 
The two were seen trying to keep it low key with their outfits, with Ramos opting for a white shirt teamed with khaki pants. He attempted to go under the radar in a blue baseball cap and shades.
Garcia, meanwhile, looked typically chic in a long floral skirt and an off-shoulder top. She was holding a jean jacket. 
Both Ramos and Garcia have denied dating, according to Pep. In separate interviews last year, they said they're just good friends, adding that they met through Julia Barretto. 
Rumors about them being a couple spread after they were spotted in Hong Kong together last November. As it turned out, Ramos was the director of Garcia's music video, shot in the city.

story:

Reviews for Xtreme Dancers' grand finals performance were mixed: Robin Padilla loved it, Angel Locsin praised them for sticking with their identity, and Vice Ganda said it wasn't their best. 
The South Cotabato group brought to the "Pilipinas Got Talent" stage Saturday a dizzying routine that saw them do impressive flips and rapid costume changes, and utilize blinding fireworks.
While Padilla was amazed by the tricks and Locsin gushed about them having a clear image as a group (one that can change costumes in a snap of finger), Vice Ganda was less excited. 
"Sadya lang this wasn't your best night," he told them, pointing out their mistakes. "But still, it didn't make you less of a performer. Mahuhusay kayo, minalas lang talaga kayo tonight."

summary: On Saturday, the billiards trick-shot artist proved that failure doesn't define a person but how he bounces back from it.
title: ‘PGT’ grand finals: Watch Jonacris Bandillo’s performance
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
He failed his first trick, supposedly the easiest of the ones he prepared for the finals of "Pilipinas Got Talent" Saturday. But the manner with which Jonacris Bandillo bounced back from his nervous start was definitely impressive. 
Showing his ability to calmly collect himself following his bad miss, Bandillo started hitting one billiard trick after billiard trick --all needing a steady hand to pull off. That's extra difficult considering that he must've have felt tense, given his worst start possible. 
"Napanganga lang ako," judge Angel Locsin acknowledged after seeing Bandillo coolly pull off his planned tricks. 
Adding to what Locsin said, co-judge Vice Ganda told Bandillo some words of comfort: "Itong gabi na ito ay isa lang sa maraming gabi ng buhay mo." 
"Pumalya ka sa simula at hindi natin alam kung saan ka dadalhin ng boto ng mga tao. Pero ang gusto lang sabihin sa iyo ay kung ano man ang mangyari tonight, may plano sa iyo ang Diyos."

summary: Their performance may have been recorded (although the hosts said that it was done in one take), but it was no less thrilling.
title: ‘PGT’ grand finals: Watch CEBECO II Blue Knights’ performance
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
As judge Vice Ganda pointed out, a lot of people can dance but very few have the courage to do it while balancing themselves on top of 40-foot electric posts. 
That's exactly why CEBECO II Blue Knights, a group of daring linesmen from Cebu, are in the grand finals of "Pilipinas Got Talent" Saturday, competing for the cash prize of P2 million. 
Their performance may have been recorded (although the hosts said that it was done in one take), but it was no less thrilling, as viewers clearly saw the posts swaying dangerously as the Blue Knights members bust out moves to songs such as "Together in Electric Dreams." 
"Napakihirap ng ginawa ninyo dahil hindi lang naman talento ng Pilipino ang ginawa ninyo, kung hindi tapang nating mga Pilipino," Vice Ganda told them afterward.

summary: For his finals act, Olvido performed Andrew E's "Humanap ka ng Panget" and imitated the "Dame Tu Cosita" dance going viral online at the moment.
title: ‘PGT’ grand finals: Watch Joven Olvido's performance
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
He made his grand entrance using the iconic "Mission Impossible" theme song. And for a second, Joven Olvido made us believe he can pull off the impossible — to win "Pilipinas Got Talent," a competition dominated by singers and dance groups in the past, using only nothing but his wit and humor. 
And with a finals performance that saw him cover Andrew E's "Humanap ka ng Panget" and imitate the "Dame Tu Cosita" dance going viral online at the moment, he may still well snatch the title as there's no denying that he's a huge crowd favorite.

'PGT' grand finals: Watch Nocturnal Dance Company's performance
‘PGT’ grand finals: Watch Kristel de Catalina’s performance

Though if one asked judges Vice Ganda and Angel Locsin, this wasn't his funniest turn on the "Pilipinas Got Talent" stage. His past routines saw him stage a parody of the golden-buzzer acts, and clearly those got more laughs than what he did Saturday night. 
But win or lose, Olvido, a tricycle driver, said that he'll go home with a smile on his face, knowing that he still had plenty of Filipinos in fits of laughter. He was also just informed that he bagged a role in Vice Ganda's new movie in December. No doubt that in the eyes of the many, whose hearts he captured through his antics, he's already a winner.

summary: Shekinah Arzaga, a 17-year-old from QC who once joined "Tawag ng Tanghalan," is the first-ever center girl of AKB48's soon-to-be-launched sister group.
title: Meet MNL48's first-ever queen
story:
Shekinah Arzaga, or Sheki for short, was crowned MNL48's center girl on "It's Showtime" this Saturday. Michael Bagtas, ABS-CBN News


A 17-year-old from Quezon City who once joined "Tawag ng Tanghalan" is the first-ever center girl of AKB48's soon-to-be-launched sister group MNL48, it was revealed Saturday. 
Shekinah Arzaga --known for her elegant voice fit for ballads-- was voted queen on "It's Showtime," earning the central position in future music videos and other public appearances by MNL48. 
Arzaga is considered one of the hardest workers of the group, having achieved her place in the top girls through perseverance. She dedicated her nights performing at birthdays and at small basketball leagues to garner votes. 
She broke down in tears when the results of the popularity poll were announced, saying: "Thank you po sa lahat ng sumuporta sa akin, thank you po sa lahat ng bumoto sa akin!"


Sheki Arzaga reacts after being named the first-ever center girl of MNL48, the sister-group of Japan's famous AKB48 idol group. Michael Bagtas, ABS-CBN News


Addressing their fans, whom she calls "sakuras," after cherry blossoms, for the first time, Arzaga promised to dedicate her career in making people happy along with the other MNL48 girls. 
"Hindi po matatapos ang MNL48 nang hindi kami nakakapagpasaya ng tao. Itong MNL48, ito po ay para sa inyo talaga," she said. 
Abby Trinidad and Marsela Guia finished second and third, respectively. They lead the group's top 7, which also included Christine Coloso, Zennae Inot, Alice de Leon and Trixie Tano. 


The top 16 girls of MNL48 were announced on "It's Showtime" this Saturday. Michael Bagtas, ABS-CBN News


As part of the top 7, they will fly to Japan and train with AKS, the talent agency that handles AKB48, in addition to being promised endorsement deals, recording contracts and opportunities to perform abroad. 
Meanwhile, included in the top 16 are: Quincy Santillan, Mary Grace Buenaventura, Lara Layar, Faith Santiago, Sayaka Awane, Jem Caldejon, Gab Skribikin, Ash Garcia, and Ella Amat. 


The MNL48 girls pose after the results of the first general elections were announced Saturday. Michael Bagtas, ABS-CBN News


The results were said to have been determined through the votes cast via the official MNL48 app. 
The MNL48 project was first announced in March 2016, with auditions beginning last December. It is one of the newest AKB48 sister groups outside of Japan in addition to already existing units in Thailand, Indonesia and Taiwan.
After its debut (date still unannounced), the all-Pinay idol group, its official website explained, will continue AKB48's concept of "idols you can meet" by performing daily at its own theater.
AKB48 was first formed in 2005, and have since become one of the most successful idol groups in Japan with album and single sales numbering tens of millions.

summary: The TNT boys just keep on making waves internationally.

story:
MANILA - After wowing the British crowd, Francis Concepcion, Mackie Empuerto and Kiefer Sanchez of the group TNT Boys showcased their singing prowess anew, this time before the American audience.
The three boys impressed American host Steve Harvey and the audience of the US edition of "Little Big Shots" with their performance of Beyoncé's power ballad "Listen."
A video clip of the group's performance was posted on the show's Facebook page and has since gone viral with over 4.5 million views and 90,000 shares.
Television host Ellen DeGeneres, who is also a producer of the show, promoted the group's performance on her Twitter page, urging Beyoncé to watch.
"Beyoncé, I hope you watch Sunday’s episode of #LittleBigShots," DeGeneres wrote.

Beyoncé, I hope you watch Sunday’s episode of #LittleBigShots. pic.twitter.com/OP4xhyN8lZ
— Ellen DeGeneres (@TheEllenShow) April 27, 2018

The three boys, who were finalists of "Tawag ng Tanghalan Kids," gained prominence after their impromptu performance of "Listen" on "Gandang Gabi Vice" went viral.
They will soon join the latest season of ABS-CBN's "Your Face Sounds Familiar."

summary: A group of acrobats flinging themselves in the air using pull-up bars, a billiards trick master, and a tricycle driver whose funny antics has millions of Filipinos tickled --these are some of the acts competing in the live finals of "Pilipinas Got Talent" Saturday night.
title: Here are the 10 acts competing in the ‘PGT’ grand finals
story:
A group of acrobats flinging themselves in the air using pull-up bars, a billiards trick master, and a tricycle driver whose funny antics has millions of Filipinos tickled --these are some of the acts competing in the live finals of "Pilipinas Got Talent" Saturday night.
Only 10 hopefuls (no singers, interestingly enough) remain in the hunt for the grand cash prize of P2 million. They'll be performing at Bren Z Guiao Convention Center in Pampanga. 
But before they do, here's a quick refresher of what they did to deserve their chance at the title as this season's champion: 



































Jonacris Bandillo won over the judges with his array of amazing billiards tricks. He got the most votes among the last batch of semifinalists last weekend. 


DWC Aeon Flex displayed some mind-boggling body-bending skills in the semifinals. 


A golden-buzzer act, Kristel de Catalina didn't disappoint when she took to the semifinals stage a spiral pole dance act that she dedicated to her son. 


More than just their ripped, glitter-decorated bodies, Bardilleranz certainly has the skills to rival many acrobats. And that showed in their semifinals star turn, earning a spot in the finals through public votes. 


Incorporating OPM and distinctively Pinoy imagery such as the balut and the dirty ice cream into their act, the Xtreme Dancers captured the hearts of the judges. 


As with Xtreme Dancers, Nocturnal Dance Company didn't have to go far for its inspiration. The group, much like its audition, fused hip-hop and folk in its performance. 


Orville Tonido had everyone in fits of laughter with her impersonation of Maja Salvador's popular "Wildflower" character Lily Cruz, and her lip-sync performance of Jessa Zaragosa's hit "Siya Ba Ang Dahilan." 


One of the more unique acts this season, the CEBECO II Blue Knights are composed of daring linemen who dance on top of 40-foot electric posts. 


Julius and Rhea lived up to being one of this season's golden-buzzer acts, as their wheelchair dance for the semis was dubbed "world-class" by the judges. 


He's carrying into the finals nothing but his wit. But considering that Joven Olvido's performance --a parody of all of this season's golden-buzzer acts-- is the most viewed among the semifinalists, there's no discounting that he's a favorite for the title.

summary: There's very little chance that JM de Guzman and Angelica Panganiban will be taking their friendship up another level.
title: Are you courting Angelica? JM sets the record straight
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
They've teased fans with a photo showing them in a near-kiss pose. 
Sorry shippers, but there's very little chance that JM de Guzman and Angelica Panganiban will be taking their friendship up another level. 
De Guzman made that clear in his interview on "Tonight With Boy Abunda" Friday, saying that he does not have plans to court his "That Thing Called Tadhana" co-star. 
"Mag-tropa po kami ni Angelica. Kulitan lang po namin iyong mga ganyan," he explained. 
He added that their group of friends is tight, sharing how they have been helping him get back on his feet after he checked himself into a rehab facility for his past drug use. 
"Iyong mga mali ko talaga dati, sinasampal nila sa mukha ko. I'm really thankful for that," he said. 
De Guzman was on the late-night talk show to promote the upcoming premiere of "Precious Hearts Romances: Araw Gabi" on Monday.

summary: The two acknowledged there was a lot of awkwardness between them at first, but were able to overcome it through acting workshops.
title: WATCH: JM shares ‘TMI’ story about kissing Barbie in ‘Araw Gabi’
story:

Judging from the trailer of "Precious Hearts Romances: Araw Gabi," it's not far-fetched to expect that JM de Guzman and Barbie Imperial will kiss a lot in this steamy drama. 
And when he was asked about how it was like working with Imperial for the intimate scenes on "Tonight with Boy Abunda" this Friday, De Guzman shared a funny anecdote from the set. 
He opened up about that one time when he didn't know that Imperial was really sick. In a case of too-much-information, he recalled his co-star telling him that she threw up before they locked lips. 
"So after niya sumuka, hindi niya alam kissing scene namin. Inamin niya sa akin iyon," he said, while adding: "Sabi ko, 'Thank for you for the information.' Sarap din." 

WATCH: Full trailer for JM de Guzman's first drama in 2 years

This is the first time De Guzman and Imperial are paired together. They acknowledged there was a lot of awkwardness between them at first, but were able to overcome it through acting workshops.

summary: "Hanggang Saan," the crime-drama series starring Sylvia Sanchez as an accused murderer, concluded Friday.
title: ‘Hanggang Saan’ finale: Edward Lamoste murder case is closed
story:
"Hanggang Saan," the crime-drama series starring Sylvia Sanchez as an accused murderer, concluded Friday with the central Edward Lamoste murder case closed, spurring opportunities for the Alipio family to achieve new dreams and finally live in peace.


Domeng (Yves Flores), Paco (Arjo Atayde), and Sonya (Sylvia Sanchez) are a picture of a happy family at the conclusion of 'Walang Hanggan.' ABS-CBN


The opening scenes of the April 27 episode were presented as a crime documentary, which recounted key developments in the case, including Sonya (Sanchez) being cleared of the allegations and Jacob (Ariel Rivera) being found guilty of killing Edward.
The fugitive Jacob did not go down without a fight, however, as he successfully abducted Sonya's sons, Paco (Arjo Atayde) and Domeng (Yves Flores). The mother's effort to save them results in a shootout, with Sonya and Paco injured, and Jacob fatally shot.
Five years later, Sonya and Paco are shown to have survived the incident. The two, along with Domeng, managed to not only live a normal life, but a prosperous one, with the sons excelling in their respective careers. Domeng became an architect, while Paco became a co-owner of the now-Vega, Alipio & Associates.
Paco and Anna (Sue Ramirez), meanwhile, reunited by chance on a beach, hinting at a happy ending to their love story, with the hindrances to their relationship now far behind them.

summary: When it comes to being quick-witted, nobody can top Vice Ganda as proven on Friday on "It's Showtime."
title: Lipat muna sa kabila — Vice Ganda’s funny reaction to broken ‘Showtime’ prop
story:
In a display of his usual quick wit, comedian Vice Ganda managed to bridge an awkward gap during the Friday episode of "It's Showtime," when a prop used during the Miss Q&A pageant segment malfunctioned.


In a hilarious moment on 'It's Showtime' Friday, Vice Ganda joked that viewers should switch channels first while a broken prop is being fixed on the Kapamilya show. ABS-CBN


During the "Tumpak, Ganern" round of the pageant, contestants race to hit their respective buzzers to be the first to answer questions from the hosts. The first two contestants to correctly answer proceed to face off in the succeeding round, eliminating one in the process.
However, during the episode, one of the 3 buzzers appeared to be broken. Whereas the two others lit up and buzzed when pressed, the middle one only triggered a sound but didn't light up.
What followed was an awkward few minutes where Vice Ganda and co-host Anne Curtis decided with staff how to go about the segment. Repairmen also scrambled to the stage to fix the prop.

'Sakit sa panga!' 10 laugh-out-loud Vice-Anne moments

Vice Ganda, however, effortlessly made light of the moment, blurting out words unexpected to be heard on the noontime show -- including the title of "It's Showtime's" rival program, "Eat Bulaga." He even addressed the "dabarkads," a term used on "Eat Bulaga" to endearingly call its audience and hosts.
The box-office star's comedic "rant" had the audience cheering.
Ultimately, Vice Ganda and Curtis were advised to keep on with the segment using the same prop. They explained that if the broken buzzer were pressed first, it would still disable the other two anyway, only that it wouldn't emit a light.

summary: The group dominated the 1970s disco scene with their glitzy costumes, kitsch dance routines and catchy melodies.
title: ABBA reunite with 2 new songs after 35 years
story:
Bjoern Ulvaeus, member of the legendary Swedish pop group ABBA poses at the new "ABBA - The Museum" in Stockholm, Sweden in 2013. Iconic Swedish music group ABBA has recorded new music for the first time in 35 years. Arnd Wiegmann, Reuters


Sweden's legendary disco group ABBA announced on Friday that they have reunited to record two new songs, 35 years after their last single.
"We all four felt that, after some 35 years, it could be fun to join forces again and go into the recording studio. So we did," the group said in a statement after repeated comments that they would never reunite. 
They said had recorded two new songs, one titled "I Still Have Faith In You", and another unnamed track.
They split up in 1982 after dominating the disco scene for more than a decade with hits like "Waterloo", "Dancing Queen", "Mamma Mia" and "Super Trouper".
"It was like time had stood still and that we only had been away on a short holiday. An extremely joyful experience!" members Agnetha Faltskog, Bjorn Ulvaeus, Anni-Frid Lyngstad and Benny Andersson added. 
The group, who sold more than 400 million albums, have not sung together on stage since 1986.
- 'Come of age' -
But now, computerized avatars are to perform "I Still Have Faith In You" in a TV special produced by NBC and expected to be broadcast by the BBC in December, the group said. 
"We have come of age, but the song is new. And it feels good."
Bjorn, 73, was married to Agnetha, 68, and Benny, 71, was married to Anni-Frid, 72.
The group dominated the 1970s disco scene with their glitzy costumes, kitsch dance routines and catchy melodies.
They first found global fame after winning the Eurovision Song Contest in 1974 with "Waterloo".
While they have appeared in public together on rare occasions, they have never reunited to perform as a group, and have vowed that won't ever happen.
"There is simply no motivation to regroup. Money is not a factor and we would like people to remember us as we were," Ulvaeus said in a 2008 interview.
Their popularity has continued to grow over the years, with the 1999 hit musical "Mamma Mia" and the 2008 film of the same name starring Meryl Streep bringing their music to a whole new generation of fans.
And ABBA's music featured prominently in two cult Australian films, "The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert" and "Muriel's Wedding", both released in 1994.
In 2013, the world's first museum dedicated to ABBA is set opened in Stockholm, offering visitors a chance to get up close and personal with the 1970s foursome with a little help from modern technology.

summary: Not a lot may know that the "The Voice Kids Philippines" winner is as good in her studies as she is in singing.
title: LOOK: Lyca Gairanod is proving to be a winner at her school, too
story:

But not a lot may know that Lyca Gairanod is as good in her studies as she is in singing that classic "heto ako ngayon" line.

summary: After the separation of Nash Aguas and Alexa Ilacad as a "love team," the onscreen tandem of Jairus Aquino and Sharlene San Pedro also comes to an end.
title: After 'NLex' love team, 'JaiLene' also parting ways
story:
Jairus Aquino and Sharlene San Pedro. ABS-CBN


Following the separation of Nash Aguas and Alexa Ilacad as a "love team," the onscreen tandem of contemporaries Jairus Aquino and Sharlene San Pedro has also come to an end. This was revealed by Aquino, 19, in an interview with ABS-CBN entertainment news site Push published Friday.
Dubbed "JaiLene," Aquino's team-up with San Pedro started in 2013 when they both joined the teen-oriented series "Luv U," which ran for three years. They were paired anew in a number of Kapamilya series, most recently "Langit Lupa" in 2016. That same year, they both joined music channel MYX as VJs.
Aquino, who was last seen on television in a 2017 episode of "Ipaglaban Mo," was asked on the status of his "love team," in light of his break from showbiz.


Jairus Aquino and Sharlene San Pedro. ABS-CBN/MYX


He explained: "Different path na rin po kasi 'yung tinahak namin. Ako, wala na po ako sa MYX, siya mas gusto niya 'yung MYX. Tapos after 'Langit Lupa' hindi naman po nasundan soap. So parang hindi rin kami nabigyan ng work as a love team, kaya 'yon. siguro hindi na rin natuloy.
"And ako, hindi na rin po masyadong naging visible. Hindi naman po sa pinili ko 'yung studies, pero dahil nga sa dami rin ng artista at ang dami rin pong love teams ngayon kaya hindi na rin po siguro pinush talaga."
Aquino added he no longer has communication with San Pedro.


'Luv U' stars Jairus Aquino, Sharlene San Pedro, Alexa Ilacad, Nash Aguas, Mika dela Cruz, and Kobi Vidanes. ABS-CBN



'Wala nang I love you': Nash says he, Alexa going separate ways

The end of "JaiLene," or at least its confirmation, comes only weeks after Aguas similarly said his team-up with Ilacad would no longer continue. Interestingly, a vocal fanbase dubbed "NashLene" has long been pushing for the pairing of Aguas and San Pedro, who were competitors in a talent search and subsequently became kiddie partners onscreen.

summary: Beauty queen Sofia Romero, Adarna's friend, baffled the net Thursday after she congratulated the actress on Instagram on her "motherhood."
title: Has she given birth? Rumors fly after Ellen is congratulated on 'motherhood'
story:
Ellen Adarna must have been scratching her head after her friend, Sofia Romero, congratulated her on her "motherhood." Adarna and Romero's Instagram accounts


Forget questions about whether she's pregnant or not, there's now some speculation that Ellen Adarna has already given birth. 
This is thanks to a friend of Adarna, Mutya ng Pilipinas 2017 second runner-up Sofia Romero, who baffled the net Thursday after she congratulated the actress on Instagram on her "motherhood." 
Seemingly forgetting that her "girl crush" has yet to open up about her supposed baby, she posted a throwback snap of them with the caption: "Congrats on motherhood. Ikaw ang nagwagi." 
The Star Magic talent has since deleted her post, but not before news outlets and gossip websites were able to take a screenshot of it. 


A screenshot of Sofia Romero's post congratulating Ellen Adarna on her 'motherhood.' She has since taken it down from her Instagram page


Adarna has yet to respond to Romero's post on her own social media pages. 
It was as early as October last year when rumors about her being pregnant with John Lloyd Cruz's child began surfacing.



 

A post shared by Ellen Adarna (@maria.elena.adarna) on Dec 27, 2017 at 8:59pm PST



She kept them swirling with her decision to skip a high-profile fashion show and hide her tummy from her photos.

summary: Daniel Padilla turned 23 on Thursday, and he had no better way of celebrating it than being surrounded by people close to his heart.
title: LOOK: Daniel celebrates 23rd birthday with loved ones
story:
Daniel Padilla turned 23 on Thursday, and he had no better way of celebrating it than being surrounded by people close to his heart.
To mark the special occasion, his mom Karla Estrada arranged an intimate formal party attended only by their family and Padilla’s close friends.
Among the celebrities who attended were Padilla’s rumored girlfriend, Kathryn Bernardo, as well as Ruffa Gutierrez, Donita Rose, Melai Cantiveros, Meryll Soriano, Ian Veneracion, Ketchup Eusebio, Khalil Ramos, and Dominic Roque, to name a few.
Also there were Padilla’s father Rommel, his uncle Robin, and the latter’s wife Mariel.
Speaking in front of the crowd, Estrada thanked everyone who came to the party and wished her son a happy birthday.
“Sa aking pinakamamahal na panganay, ang unang nagbigay ng kahulugan ng masayang buhay, I love you, anak. Happy birthday,” Estrada said.
“Ipagpatuloy mo ang maganda mong sinimulan at sana ma-enjoy mo itong journey mo, at sana mas marami ka pang mapasayang tao.”
Rommel, on the other hand, talked to ABS-CBN about how proud he is of Padilla for being a good son and brother.
“Ako ay masayang masaya dahil ikaw ay nagiging mabuting kapatid, anak. Ang iyong blessing ay iyong binabahagi sa iyong pamilya at sa mga taong nangangailangan. Nandiyan ka parati para sa aming lahat,” he said.
“Maraming, maraming salamat anak at nawa’y bigyan ka ng magandang kalusugan ng ating mahal na Panginoong Diyos. Nagpapasalamat din ako sa iyong mga tagahanga dahil sila ang nagbigay sa iyo ng kinalalagyan mo ngayon. Happy birthday,” he added.
To complete the night, Bernardo also has a special message for Padilla.
“My wish for DJ siguro, marami siyang gustong bagong gawin this year so sana magawa niya iyon. Nandito lang kami to support him and sana lagi niyang ma-feel na mahal na mahal siya ng mga taong nakapaligid sa kanya. Stay happy,” she said.

summary: It has been almost six years since he last appeared in a Kapamilya series, and Jolo Revilla is thrilled to be acting on television again.
title: Jolo thanks Coco for inviting him to guest in 'Ang Probinsyano'
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
MANILA – It has been almost six years since he last appeared in a Kapamilya series, and Jolo Revilla is thrilled to be acting on television again.
Currently, the actor-politician can be seen in the top-rating show “FPJ’s Ang Probinsyano” starring Coco Martin.
His last TV series with ABS-CBN was “My Binondo Girl” starring Kim Chiu in 2012.
“Actually mas lalo pa akong na-excite tapos natutuwa at nagagalak dahil binigyan tayo ng pagkakataon na makabalik ulit,” he said on “Magandang Buhay” when asked if he’s having a hard time adjusting to the demands of acting once again.
Revilla said he and Coco Martin are very good friends, and he did not need a lot of convincing when he was offered the role.
“Siyempre si Coco matagal na nating kaibigan iyan. Iyong first launching film ko noon, iyong Agimat, magkasama kami doon. Tinanggap niya ang pagkakontrabida sa akin kahit maliit iyong role. Kumbaga, siyempre nagpapasalamat tayo sa kanya dahil alam natin na ang lakas ng show niya at talagang maganda naman,” he said.
Was it Martin who personally invited him to join the show?
“Actually nagkita kami sa airport. Sabi niya, ‘Guest kita ha? Guest kita!’ Sabi ko, ‘Thank you, thank you!’ Nahanapan na daw niya ako ng role,” Revilla narrated.
Despite being back in showbiz, Revilla said his constituents in Cavite need not worry that he might neglect his duties to the province.
“Nagi-give way naman ang show kung may kailangan akong puntahan sa province,” he said.

summary: Gabriel, 13, is Jolo Revilla’s son with his former girlfriend Grace Adriano, the daughter of actress Rosanna Roces.
title: How is Jolo as a father? His 13-year-old son opens up
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
In a rare moment, the son of Jolo Revilla joined him for a sit-down interview on “Magandang Buhay” where they opened up about their father-son relationship.
Gabriel, 13, is Revilla’s son with his former girlfriend Grace Adriano, the daughter of actress Rosanna Roces.
Revilla described himself as a strict father who knows when to discipline his son.
“Strikto na nasa lugar. Alam naman natin ngayon na ang mga kabataan, open sila sa Internet, sa social media. Iyon ang kailangan nating bigyan ng pagtingin kasi, kung ano-ano ang mga sites na pwede nilang puntahan,” he said.
When asked for a specific rule he strictly imposes on his son, Revilla said: “Ngayon, inalis ko muna ang social media sa kanya.”
“Before talagang nakatutok iyan sa iPad. Actually, sapilitan pa kami. Kailangan ko pa talaga i-confiscate kasi minsan late na nakakatulog. Iyong age nila, iyan iyong tatangkad pa. At the same time, varsity player din kasi ito,” he added.
Although he envies his friends who are free to have social media accounts, Gabriel understands where his dad is coming from.
“Minsan [mahirap]. Every time I see people using social media, medyo naiinggit din ako,” Gabriel said. “Alam ko naman na ginagawa niya iyon dahil love niya ako.”
Meanwhile, both also talked about the possibility of Gabriel venturing into show business as well.
“Kung ako ang tatanungin, wala namang problema. Pero kailangang mag-focus pa rin siya sa pag-aaral dahil iyon ang pinakamagandang regalo na puwedeng ibigay ng mga bata sa kanilang magulang,” said Revilla.
Gabriel, for his part, said he is not thinking about following the footsteps of his father, grandparents, and great grandfather just yet.
For now, Revilla and Gabriel are happy to share bonding moments together outside of the limelight.
“Kapag may game siya out of the country, sumasama ako. Katulad noong sa Guam, magkakasama kami. Minsan sinusundo ko sa school. Ito hilig din nito kumain,” Revilla said.

summary: Nagbigay update si Shaina Magdayao sa pelikulang “Ang Panahon ng Halimaw” na isa sa pinakakakaibang proyekto na nagawa niya bilang aktres.
title: Shaina, natanong kung kailan magpapakilala ng inspirasyon
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
MANILA - Nagbigay-update si Shaina Magdayao sa pelikulang “Ang Panahon ng Halimaw” na isa sa pinakakakaibang proyekto na nagawa niya bilang aktres.
Kasama si Piolo Pascual at binigyang direksyon ni Lav Diaz, hindi makakalimutan ni Shaina ang experience habang ginagawa ang pelikula.
“May 23, that’s our commercial run. And on the 22nd, meron din kaming premiere night. Lahat po ng lines namin doon, hindi namin sinalita. Lahat doon kinanta. It was composed by direk Lav. Parang nanonood ka ng musical. Sabi nga ni direk Lav, isang rock opera,” kuwenot ni Shaina.
Natanong din si Shaina tungkol sa kanyang personal na buhay, partikular kung kailan na ba siya muli magpapakilala ng inspirasyon sa kanyang followers.
“Apparently, marami pang pinapagawa sa akin na projects. Ayaw pa akong pagpahingahin. Don’t get me wrong, I’m very grateful sa mga trabaho na dumadating sa akin. In perfect time, mangyayari po iyon. Kung kailan, hindi ko alam,” kuwento ni Shaina.
Isa sa mga pinagkaabalahan ni Shaina ay ang “Single Single, Love is Not Enough” na pelikula nila ni Matteo Guidicelli.
Proud si Shaina na matapos ang dalawang matagumpay na season sa Cinema One ay sa big screen na magpapatuloy ang kuwento ng karakter nilang sina Joey at Joee.
“Hindi ko expected na it will become a movie. I am grateful na from the first season, nasundan ng second season na hindi din po namin expected. Four years after, we have a movie. Never in my wildest dreams na naisip kong magkaka-movie kami,” aniya.
Showing na sa May 2 ang “Single Single, Love is Not Enough.”
tags: Single Single Love is Not Enough

summary: Nag-premier ang crime film na Smaller and smaller circles, black comedy na Chedeng at Apple at ang musical drama na Ang Larawan na nag-compete sa Far East Film Festival sa Udine, Italy noong April 20-28
title: Pinoy films tampok sa Italian film festival
story:
The Philippine delegation to the Far East Film Festival in Udine, Italy. Photo courtesy of Girlie Rodis


UDINE, Italy – Nag-premier ang tatlong pelikulang Pilipino na lumaban sa Far East Film Festival sa Udine na nagsimula noong Abril 20 hanggang 28.
Kasama ng black comedy na "Chedeng at Apple" sa premier ang crime film na "Smaller and Smaller Circles" at ang musical drama na "Ang Larawan."
Sa pagdiriwang ng ika-100 taon ng Philippine cinema ay pinangunahan ng Film Development Council of the Philippines ang delegasyon ng filmmakers, actors at members ng academe sa 20th edition ng Far East Film Festival.
Proud na proud naman ang "Ang Larawan" actresses at producers na sina Celeste Legaspi at Rachel Alejandro na nabibigyan ng pagkakataon na maipakita ang galing ng Pilipino sa paggawa ng mga dekalidad na pelikula.
“I love that all 3 films are so different and represent a different part of the culture. So you know it’s nice. So we’re now giving like an option. We’re presenting our country and our culture in so many different ways,” sabi ni Alejandro.
Sa kabila ng pabagu-bagong trend sa pelikula ay kayang makipagsabayan ng bansa sa mga international films.
“We ‘re very happy that technically the country, the industry in the Philippines, has really gone very far. The sound, the editing, the special effects and we can proudly say we can really produce very excellent films,” sabi naman ni Legaspi.
Ayon sa veteran actress na si Elizabeth Oropesa, sa kabila ng tagumpay ng Filipino movies na naipapalabas sa ibang bansa, kailangan pa rin palakasin ang popularidad ng mga ito sa Pilipinas.
“The Philippines is missing a lot. We are being honored in other countries but not enough acknowledgement for us in our own country,” sabi ni Oropesa.
Dagdag pa ni “Ang Larawan” director Loy Arcenas na mayaman ang Pilipinas sa magagaling na filmmakers at actors pero kaunti lamang ang nabibigyang pansin.
“We are really trying to find a niche...and I wish people back home would pay more attention kasi marami tayong maibibigay,” aniya.
Bisitahin ang Patrol.PH para sa iba pang mga balita.

summary: The family of Swedish DJ Avicii, who was found dead last week in Oman at the age of 28, said on Thursday that he struggled with life and 'could not go on any longer.'
title: Swedish DJ Avicii 'could not go on any longer,' family says
story:
Swedish musician, DJ, remixer and record producer Avicii (Tim Bergling) takes a selfie on Table Mountain, South Africa back in January 11, 2018. Photo credit: Avicii's Instagram page


The family of Swedish DJ Avicii, who was found dead last week in Oman at the age of 28, said on Thursday that he struggled with life and "could not go on any longer."
In their first comment on his death, the cause of which has not been disclosed, the family said in a statement: "He really struggled with thoughts about Meaning, Life, Happiness. He could not go on any longer. He wanted to find peace."
The statement appeared to suggest that the electronic dance musician and producer took his own life. His U.S. publicist, Diana Baron, declined to comment further.
Avicii, whose real name was Tim Bergling, was one of the biggest stars of electronic dance music (EDM). He was found dead in Muscat, Oman, last Friday but no cause of death was released.
Avicii, known for international hits such as "Wake Me Up" and "Hey Brother," announced in 2016 that he was retiring from touring, citing the demands of the lifestyle.
"Our beloved Tim was a seeker, a fragile artistic soul searching for answers to existential questions. An over-achieving perfectionist who traveled and worked hard at a pace that led to extreme stress," the family's statement said on Thursday.
"When he stopped touring, he wanted to find a balance in life to be happy and be able to do what he loved most – music," it added.
Avicii's death shocked the music world, particularly in Europe.
Church bells played one of Avicii's biggest hits in the Swedish capital Stockholm on Tuesday. (Reporting by Jill Serjeant Editing by Susan Thomas)
Editor's note:
A group in the Philippines is dedicated to addressing those who have suicidal tendencies.
The crisis hotlines of the Natasha Goulbourn Foundation aim to make these individuals feel that someone is ready to listen to them.

summary: It was supposed to be a happy photo — Pokwang's baby daughter posing with her godparents — but some people just had to ruin it.
title: How Chokoleit dealt with basher insulting him as ninong of Pokwang's baby
story:
Ang mag BFF’s ay certified na magkukumare na rin! #binyagnitisaymalia ❤️❤️❤️
A post shared by  Carmela Brosas (@kbrosas) on Apr 15, 2018 at 4:02am PDT



It was supposed to be a happy photo — Pokwang's baby daughter posing with her godparents — but some people just had to ruin it. 
Last week, K Brosas posted the photo on Instagram and was greeted by fans commenting on the baby's cuteness. One, though, had other ideas and saw it as a chance to take a swipe at Brosas and other godparents Pooh and Chokoleit. 
The particular follower had the gall to say that she doesn't like the choice of ninongs and ninangs for the baby. This inspired a rant from Brosas, who said that looks aren't everything.



 

Never ko pang ginawa to.. ang mag post ng ganito.. Napaka sama naman ng ugali mo Kung ibabase mo SA itsura namin kung karapat dapat kami.. lalo na hindi ka naman KAGANDAHAN (profile pic mo teh) Buti sana kung nilagyan mo ng “joke lang po” o “chos” .. at kung magpapatawa ka dapat mas nakakatawa ka sa 4 na komedyanteng pinansin mo.. haaay! Nakaka sad na may katulad Mong tao.. ok Lang Kung sinabi mo na hindi ako maganda etc kc opinion mo yon, pero para husgahan mo kami bilang mga ninang eh kapatol patol ka! Sa mga followers ko sensya na ha.. Di ko napigilan.. ipagdarasal kita tehh @iambabelyne .. pero sa ngayon bigyan kita ng exposure! Palakpakan!! 👏👏👏😝😝😝
A post shared by  Carmela Brosas (@kbrosas) on Apr 15, 2018 at 7:20am PDT



But unlike Brosas, who even posted the follower's username, Chokoleit is choosing to just ignore the negativity altogether, he said in an interview on "Tonight With Boy Abunda" Thursday. 
Clapping back, he described the bashers as "shallow," "senseless," and "immature." He added that he "just pity the petty" and that the kid's lucky because "napapalibutan siya ng happiness."

summary: " . . . The tap on my shoulder, and kiss on my forehead were all I needed to give me that extra push."
title: ‘I was about to lose it’: Anne writes open letter to ‘cheerleader’ Erwan
story:
To my number one cheerleader, videographer, photographer and support line. To the one that made an effort to meet me at mile 10, 21 and 24, THANK YOU ❤️ Your voice saying “it’s ok, you’re almost there”, the tap on my shoulder and kiss on my forehead were all I needed to give me that extra push when I was about lose it. 😂 I told you I NEED YOU THERE. Always ❤️ Thank you for always pushing me to be the best version of myself even when I feel like quitting. Thank you for being the calm to my crazy. Je t’aime. @erwan
A post shared by  Anne Curtis (@annecurtissmith) on Apr 26, 2018 at 5:41am PDT



Anne Curtis was "about to lose it" as she approached the final stretch of the 42-kilometer London Marathon, but she ultimately triumphed amid exhaustion, thanks to her her "number one cheerleader," who showed up several times on the sidelines to greet and encourage her.

WATCH: Exhausted Anne cries and turns back to Erwan at London marathon

That cheerleader is her husband, restaurateur and vlogger Erwan Heussaff, to whom Curtis penned an open letter she shared on Instagram Thursday night. In the caption of a photo showing her with Heussaff, as she held up her finisher medal, the 30-year-old actress wrote:
"To my number one cheerleader, videographer, photographer and support line, to the one that made an effort to meet me at mile 10, 21 and 24, thank you.
"Your voice saying 'It's okay, you're almost there,' the tap on my shoulder, and kiss on my forehead were all I needed to give me that extra push when I was about lose it."

 
Curtis was referring to a moment captured in a video edited by Heussaff, documenting his wife's flight to London until she finished the marathon. About to continue running after approaching Heussaff on the sidelines, Curtis turned back to her husband another time, this time crying.
"I'm tired," she told Heussaff, whose motivated her to keep on with her personal mission to help children in recovering Marawi, through UNICEF-Philippines.

LOOK: Nearly giving up, Anne Curtis finishes London Marathon

In her letter, Curtis continued: "Thank you for always pushing me to be the best version of myself even when I feel like quitting. Thank you for being the calm to my crazy. Je t’aime."



 

The smile you make when you get to the home stretch. All the pain, cramps, crazy thoughts, the shortness of breath disappear. You realize YOU’VE DONE IT. The feeling of euphoria rushes through your body and the smile cannot be erased off of your face. 😃 I let the @unicefphils flag fly high and proud knowing that all the pain, tears and each of the 42 kilometers were worth it. THE CHILDREN OF THE PHILIPPINES ARE WORTH IT. I will never tire of doing what I can - whether a big or small gesture - to help make this world a better place for children. Thank you to everyone that donated! As of today, we have raised 381,707 and still counting on my simply giving page!!! I’ve read all the comments and I’m truly so grateful. From the bottom of my heart, a humongous hug and kiss to everyone around the world that donated. As promised, I shall match the final amount. All funds raised will go towards UNICEF’S response for Marawi Children 💙🇵🇭💙 Again, THANK YOU! #LondonMarathon #LondonMarathANNEventure
A post shared by  Anne Curtis (@annecurtissmith) on Apr 24, 2018 at 8:56pm PDT

summary: Kris Aquino's now-confirmed role in the Hollywood film "Crazy Rich Asians" had long been the subject of hype and speculation, so fans of the actress were disappointed when she wasn't shown in the romcom's trailer released early this week.
title: 'Extra ka lang ba'? Kris answers fan after 'Crazy Rich Asians' trailer
story:
A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Mar 20, 2018 at 8:35am PDT



Kris Aquino's now-confirmed role in the Hollywood film "Crazy Rich Asians" had long been the subject of hype and speculation, so fans of the actress were disappointed when she wasn't shown in the film's trailer released early this week.
On Instagram Thursday, Aquino shared a clip of a wall of portraits, apparently all the characters in the Warner Bros. production, hers among them. Aquino, however, strategically covered her character's name with a heart emoji.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
In the comments of that post, one follower directly addressed Aquino about her role. He wrote, unedited: "Napanood ko trailer, pero di kita nakita? Extra ka lang ba dun?! I thought you're one of the main characters."
Responding to the comment, Aquino said: "As recently as Friday I said I'm there for 5 minutes, but I do portray a [princess]. Dude, I'm part of a Warner Brothers history-making movie because it's the first non-period, all Asian, big Hollywood multi-million production. #proudtorepresentphilippines"



 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Apr 25, 2018 at 10:01am PDT



Aquino was referring to her interview with reporters last week, on the sidelines of her contract-signing with ABS-CBN's film outfit Star Cinema.
At the time, she revealed, for the first time, that she is portraying royalty in "Crazy Rich Asians," but that she will only be part of two scenes overall.



 

A post shared by Crazy Rich Asians (@crazyrichasians) on Apr 23, 2018 at 6:02am PDT



Based on the Kevin Kwan novel of the same name, "Crazy Rich Asians" follows Chinese-American professor Rachel Chu, who belatedly discovers that her long-time boyfriend, Henry, comes from a "crazy rich" family when she accompanies him to Singapore for his best friend's wedding.
The John M. Chu-directed flick is set for release in Philippine cinemas on August 22.

summary: They didn't even have to use one of the infinity stones to rewrite the record books, after Marvel Studios' 'Avengers: Infinity War' earned the biggest opening day in the Philippines' movie-going history.
title: 'Avengers: Infinity War' crushes box-office records in PH
story:
Captain America (Chris Evans) leads a group of superheroes against Thanos (Josh Brolin) in 'Avengers: Infinity War'. Photo credit: Marvel Studios


MANILA -- They didn't even have to use one of the infinity stones to rewrite the record books, after Marvel Studios' "Avengers: Infinity War" earned the biggest opening day in the Philippines' movie-going history. 
The superhero blockbuster, starring Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr, among many, took in P141.6 million in its first full day, which Disney said is the most a movie has ever made in its debut here in the country. 

Movie review: Terrifying Thanos the highlight of 'Avengers: Infinity War'

It also shattered the single-day box office record, previously held by "Beauty and the Beast." The live adaptation of the beloved classic earned P100.3 million back in March 18 last year. 
"Avengers: Infinity War," which had its premiere in the Philippines on Wednesday, has won good reviews from movie critics, and is due out in North America this Friday. 

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv

summary: Warning: This article contains spoilers for 'Avengers: Infinity War'
title: Yes, that 'Avengers: Infinity War' scene is in PH
story:
WARNING: THIS ARTICLE CONTAINS SPOILERS FOR 'AVENGERS: INFINITY WAR'


In a promotional image released earlier this year, Thanos (Josh Brolin) uses the powers of the infinity stones to attack the Avengers. Marvel Studios


Billed as a culmination of a decade-long film saga, fans were certain that "Avengers: Infinity War" would be epic in scale, a movie full of superhero badassery, fatal twists, and a villain worthy of fear -- one that wasn't just a CGI blob made to be punched. 
And while it certainly did not disappoint in that regard (the less said the better), there's also something a little extra in it for Filipinos. You see by the end, Thanos (Josh Brolin) walks out of what appears to be a small hut to watch the sunset. 

REVIEW: Terrifying Thanos the highlight of 'Avengers: Infinity War'

Just beyond him are terraced rice paddies that look like giant stairways on the slopes of a mountain. If that sounds familiar to you, it's probably because it has been confirmed to be the Philippines' famous Banaue Rice Terraces. 
A representative from Disney told ABS-CBN News' Marie Lozano that the filmmakers at Marvel Studios planned for Thanos to retreat to the Ifugao province following the events of the movie. 
It's similar to the ending of the Infinity Gauntlet -- the comic book series where the "Avengers: Infinity War" was based on -- in which Thanos exiles himself to work as a farmer to reflect on his loss. 


A photo of Thanos in 'Avengers: Infinity War' and from inside the pages of the Infinity Gauntlet comic book series. Marvel Studios and Marvel Comics


And if you're wondering, no, Brolin did not fly to the Philippines to shoot the poignant scene. Marvel Studios used footage of the Banaue Rice Terraces acquired with the help of Indochina Productions, a production studio based in Thailand, and applied visual effects to create it. 
On Facebook this Wednesday, Indochina Productions shared the photo used as inspiration for Thanos' exile location of choice, saying that they were proud to be included in the movie's end credits.

summary: It’s not every day that Kapamilya singer Moira dela Torre opens up about her family on social media.
title: Moira opens up about memorable reunion with her father
story:
A post shared by Moira Dela Torre (@moirarachelle) on Apr 24, 2018 at 2:57am PDT



It’s not every day that Kapamilya singer Moira dela Torre opens up about her family on social media. 
But that’s what she exactly did on Wednesday, sharing to her thousands of followers the memorable reunion she had with her father, whom she hasn’t seen for years.
According to dela Torre, her parents separated when she was just three years old. Her mom got the custody, hence, her father “tried to kidnap” her at that time.
“To protect me, my mom and I went into hiding in Olongapo where I stayed mostly indoors for the next few years. Mrs. Doubtfire was my best friend. I had the whole movie memorized. Although I didn't understand what was happening then, I remember understanding that I was in a similar situation as Mrs. Doubtfire's kids, secretly wishing my dad would show up dressed as a nanny,” she wrote.
Dela Torre said the movie’s happy ending gave her hope that her father would also one day show up and so she waited.
“True enough, 12 years later, he came back into my life. No more kidnapping or hidden agendas. He never dressed up as a nanny either but God had healed both him and my mom and I've had two homes since then,” she said.
The 24-year-old singer also narrated one unforgettable moment which happened in San Francisco last August.
“We got to visit Mrs. Doubtfire's home. This time spent with my dad, however brief it was, was one of the most surreal moments of my life. It was when it sunk in how faithful God really is. It was a dream to see him again in good terms with everyone, in the proper conditions. No cases. No papers. No issues. No drama,” she said.
Dela Torre said that moment was special because it was the same film that helped her understand “that love defies distance and time” back when she was younger.
“I stood in front of that very house next to the man I once thought I'd never see again. Now, my dad has become a man of God, dedicated to his family. He works so hard to make sure we're all well taken care of. He is a great listener. He's everyone's favorite uncle. Every night, before going to bed, he calls our family in his room to pray,” she said.
“I know he will always see me as a 3 year old, but I'm blessed that he has learned to let go, supported me, and let me be my own person-- something I know was very hard for him to do with his first born.”
To end her lengthy post, Dela Torre said she paid tribute to him because she wants her father to know “that his efforts never go unnoticed, that I honor him and that I feel blessed and privileged to be able to call him my father.”
“Thank you for everything, Daddy. Thank you for being God's reminder to me that just because our past was broken doesn't mean our future will be, too,” she said.
