summary: Luis Manzano credited his girlfriend Jessy Mendiola for gathering both sides of his family in one place for his birthday.
title: Luis thanks Jessy for bringing his family together on his birthday
story:
MANILA – Luis Manzano credited his girlfriend Jessy Mendiola for gathering both sides of his family in one place for his birthday.
As seen on his Instagram post, Manzano got to celebrate his special day not just with Mendiola but also with his father Edu Manzano, mother Vilma Santos-Recto, step-father,Senator Ralph Recto and half-brother Ryan.
The family of his girlfriend was likewise present during the occasion.



 

A post shared by Luis Manzano (@luckymanzano) on Apr 21, 2018 at 9:54pm PDT



“What a night!!!!! The night was all about the smiles on our faces in these pictures!! Thank you very much to my wonderful howhow (Jessy) for bringing EVERYONE together,” he said.
“I just realized that it was the first time that both sides of my family were in one place AND... your family being there too!!! I love the family pic.”
Manzano then thanked everyone who attended the party which was held at a restaurant at Solaire Resort and Casino.
The “I Can See Your Voice” host turned a year older on April 21.

summary: Ang ultimate ganap sa kanyang 15th anniversary ang isang concert na ia-announce ang detalye very soon.
title: Jed Madela, may bagong album, concert para sa ika-15 taon sa showbiz
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
MANILA -- Excited na ibinahagi ng Kapamilya singer na si Jed Medela ang kanyang pagbabalik sa reality talent show franchise na "Your Face Sounds Familiar Kids."
Kung judge noon si Jed sa unang dalawang season ng palabas, mentor naman ngayon si Jed at hands-on sa pagtuturo ng celebrity contestants. 
"Ngayon, busy tayo sa 'Tawag Ng Tanghalan,' 'ASAP' every Sunday. Tapos may tini-tape kami ngayon," ani Jed.
Pinagkakaabalahan din ni Jed ang pagbuo sa isang espesyal na album para sa 15 years niya sa showbiz industry.
 
"Nag re-record ako ngayon ng bago kong album in line with my 15th anniversary. So this year is going be busy," ani Jed.
At ang ultimate ganap sa kanyang 15th anniversary ang isang concert na ia-announce ang detalye very soon.
"Unang una, iniipon namin 'yung team. And 'yung team na makakatrabaho ko sa concert na ito kailangan, magka-level kami ng mga gusto siyempre and mindset. Lalong-lalo na itong concert, na ito kasi major concert, malaking vene kaya talagang pinaghahandaan namin," ani Jed.
Bisitahin ang Patrol.PH para sa iba pang mga balita.

summary: "A Quiet Place" had another noisy weekend at the domestic box office, reclaiming the No. 1 slot in its third frame.
title: 'A Quiet Place' back on top, 'Super Troopers 2' smokes projections
story:
A scene from 'A Quiet Place'



LOS ANGELES -- "A Quiet Place" had another noisy weekend at the domestic box office, reclaiming the No. 1 slot in its third frame.
John Krasinski's thriller co-starring Emily Blunt continued on its stellar run, earning $21.8 million from 3,808 locations. "A Quiet Place" had another impressive holdover, declining only 34 percent to bring its domestic tally to $132 million. That was enough to top Dwayne Johnson's "Rampage" and Amy Schumer's "I Feel Pretty."
Bumped down to No. 2, Dwayne Johnson's "Rampage" collected $20.3 million in 4,115 theaters in its second weekend. The film has made $66 million at the North American box office. Luckily, "Rampage" has been able to justify its expensive price tag with a strong international showing. It has crossed the $200-million mark internationally, claiming $57 million this weekend. That brings its global tally to $283 million.
STX's "I Feel Pretty" bowed in third with $15.8 million from 3,440 theaters. The Schumer-led comedy also features Michelle Williams, Rory Scovel, Emily Ratajkowski, Busy Phillips and Aidy Bryant. "I Feel Pretty" is currently averaging a tepid 34 percent rating on Rotten Tomatoes, as well as a B+ CinemaScore.
Another newcomer, Fox Searchlight's "Super Troopers 2," opened in fourth, burning by projections to make $15 million from 2,038 locations. The sequel reunites the 2002 cult classic's leads -- Jay Chandrasekhar, Kevin Heffernan, Steve Lemme, Paul Soter, and Erik Stolhanske -- collectively known as Broken Lizard. The stoner comedy has a 35 percent rating on Rotten Tomatoes, the same score as the original. The audience score of the sequel, however, is down significantly from the original's, at 68 percent compared to the first movie's 90 percent. The first film launched with $6 million.
The final weekend opener is Lionsgate's Codeblack Films' "Traffik," which took in $3.9 million in 1,024 theaters.
Rounding out the top five is Universal and Blumhouse's "Truth or Dare." Lucy Hale and Tyler Posey lead the thriller, which scored $7.9 million in 3,068 locations. In total, the horror film has made $30.4 million in two weeks.
The domestic box office is up 12.6 percent compared to the same weekend last year, though the year to date box office is down 2.4 percent. That could change next weekend as "Avengers: Infinity War" eyes a monstrous opening weekend.
"The industry is bracing for the record-setting debut of the highly anticipated 'Avengers: Infinity War' that is expected to break through the $200 million opening weekend sound barrier as the summer movie season of 2018 gets off to an early and auspicious start," said comScore box office analyst Paul Dergarabedian.

story:

On Sunday's live semifinals in Taytay, Rizal, Bandillo amped up his tricks, wowing the judges with his precision and skill.

"Ako, grabe. Hanggang ngayon hindi pa rin ako maka-recover, na hindi ko pa rin alam ang sasabihin ko kasi napanganga ako. Na-amaze ako kung papaano mo nagawa 'yun," Angel Locsin told Bandillo.
Noting that no one did their acts perfectly, Vice Ganda also showed his support to Bandillo by asking the viewers to vote for him.
"Meron kang isang pumalya na eksena kanina, 'yung second to the last. Pero sa lahat naman ng performances sa 'PGT,' wala namang nag-perform ng perfect. Lahat diyan, merong nakalimutang isang step, lahat diyan merong isang joke na hindi nakakatawa. May magic na medyo nabubuking. Lahat 'yan hindi perfect. 'Yung performance mo hindi perfect, pero ikaw pa rin ang gusto kong iboto ko ng madlang people," he said.
Bandillo received 35.37% of viewers' votes.

summary: Julia Barretto was unable to stop herself from addressing a netizen who has been attacking her in a series of posts on Twitter following the controversy that she and love team partner Joshua Garcia recently got embroiled in.
title: LOOK: Julia Barretto responds to basher with class
story:
Julia Barretto was unable to stop herself from addressing a netizen who has been attacking her in a series of posts on Twitter following the controversy that she and love team partner Joshua Garcia recently got embroiled in.
In her reply to a netizen who goes by the name Jewel Medina, Barretto pointed out that no one has the right to attack her especially because nobody knows what’s happening between her and Garcia behind the cameras.

.@JewelMedina3 pic.twitter.com/725GEU24tD
— Julia Barretto (@BarrettoJulia) April 21, 2018

“You don’t understand the gravity of the situation and you can’t simply hate what you can’t understand. Not any one of you know even 1/4 of the things both Joshua and I go through or the beautiful things we share together, for everything you all see and hear are only the things we choose to share,” she said.
Barretto also emphasized how much she and Garcia value each other.
“I don’t think you understand the amount of love and respect both Joshua and I have for each other. The things we both do to protect each other and that in trials like this how much we hold onto each other for strength just so we don’t give the people who are trying to put us down the power to actually put us down. We will get up and stand up together,” she said.
Ending her statement, Barretto told Medina to “focus on the things that will fill your heart up with only positivity and love. Be kind to your soul for how you treat it, will reflect how you treat others.”
In an interview on “Tonight with Boy Abunda” last week, Barretto said the bump in her relationship with Garcia isn't high enough that it can't be navigated through together. 
Barretto said they built "something beautiful" that she's not willing to throw away that easily.

summary: Veteran composer and musical director Ryan Cayabyab took to social media to pay tribute to Regine Velasquez, who is celebrating her birthday on Sunday.
title: Ryan Cayabyab thanks Regine 'for breathing life to our songs'
story:
A post shared by reginevalcasid (@reginevalcasid) on Apr 6, 2018 at 4:49am PDT



MANILA – Veteran composer and musical director Ryan Cayabyab took to social media to pay tribute to Regine Velasquez, who is celebrating her birthday on Sunday.
In a lengthy Facebook post, Cayabyab thanked "Asia’s Songbird" for breathing life to a lot of OPM songs.
“Thank you for creating magic and painting varied hues and emotions to songs that we have written,” he began.
Cayabyab then went on to enumerate the songs he wrote which Velasquez brought to heights he never dreamed could be achieved.
First in the list is “Tuwing Umuulan at Kapiling Ka” which Cayabyab originally composed for Basil Valdez.
“I wrote this for Basil and it is the definitive version. When the Eraserheads sang it, I said whoa...puede palang ganun!!!!! Ang galeng! And then you recorded it. I was mesmerized,” he said.
He said Velasquez’s version “has so much pent up emotions, is so sensitively sung, there is so much happiness yet there is so much longing and pining.”
“Ang ganda ng pagka-awit,” he gushed.
Another song which Cayabyab noted is “Sometime, Somewhere.”
“Again I wrote it for Basil. It is still the definitive version. But then again, you sang it...and OWNED IT. Basil never sang it again...that is why this song rightfully belongs to you now,” he said.
Also special is the song “Araw, Gabi,” which Cayabyab wrote for his wife’s last birthday before they got married.
“We recorded it and gave away 45s during our wedding. Nonoy Z originally and beautifully sang it. But you know what? In its 33 years as a song, it has never attained the popularity that it has reached now. And it is all because of you,” he said.
“You sang it...oh so beautifully, and suddenly it has become an anthem for singers who are in love.”
For everything Velasquez has done, Cayabyab said he cannot be any more grateful. He then wished the acclaimed singer a happy birthday.
“Iba na kapag hinaplos mo ang isang awit,” he said. “Isang maligayang pagbati sa iyong kaarawan. Pagpalain ka lagi ng ating maawaing Ama na nasa langit. Nawa'y bigyan ka pa ng napakaraming taon upang namnamin ang kanyang pagmamahal. Ikaw ay pinagpala! Mabuhay ka Regine!”

summary: Actor Verne Troyer, known for playing the diminutive character Mini-Me in the 'Austin Powers' movie, has died aged 49.
title: 'Mini-Me' actor Verne Troyer dies at 49
story:
Actor Verne Troyer arrives on the red carpet at the Muhammad Ali Celebrity Fight Night Awards XIX in Phoenix, Arizona March 23, 2013. Ralph Freso, Reuters


Actor Verne Troyer, known for playing the diminutive character Mini-Me in the "Austin Powers" movie, has died aged 49.
Troyer's passing was announced on his Facebook page on Saturday (April 21).
"It is with great sadness and incredibly heavy hearts to write that Verne passed away today," the statement read. "Verne was also a fighter when it came to his own battles. Over the years he's struggled and won, struggled and won, struggled and fought some more, but unfortunately this time was too much."
Troyer was born with a condition called achondroplasia dwarfism. He measured at 2 feet, 8 inches tall (0.81 meters).

summary: Avicii's representative announced his death in a statement on Friday without specifying the cause, with reports saying he had been on vacation in Oman.
title: 'No criminal suspicion' in DJ Avicii's death: Oman police source
story:
A police source in Oman said Saturday there was no suspicion of criminal activity after Swedish DJ superstar Avicii was found dead in the Gulf sultanate's capital Muscat.
The 28-year-old's representative announced his death in a statement on Friday without specifying the cause, with reports saying he had been on vacation in Oman.

Swedish electronic music DJ Avicii found dead at age 28

"Two autopsies were carried out, one yesterday and one today and we absolutely confirmed that there is no criminal suspicion in the death," the source with Oman's Royal Police told AFP, speaking on condition of anonymity.
"We have all the information and details regarding the death and this incident," the source said, adding that police would not be making any public statement on the case.
Avicii was one of the world's most successful DJs but struggled to cope with the hard-partying lifestyle and two years ago announced his retirement from touring amid recurring health scares. 
Avicii has spoken publicly in recent years about his health problems, including pancreatitis, triggered in part by excessive drinking.

story:

He's busy promoting the forthcoming release of his album, "Voicenotes," due out next month. 
But American singer and songwriter Charlie Puth found some time to invite over AC Bonifacio, who first rose to fame as part of the dancing duo Lucky Aces, to his villa in Los Angeles for a chat. 
Bonifacio, now a recording artist and video blogger, was supposed to catch one of Puth's preview performances, but wasn't able to because she wasn't old enough to be inside the venue. 
She had been invited as part of the campaign to help spread the word about "Voicenotes," uploading a vlog earlier about a welcome gift she received from Puth as she arrived in LA with her mom.


AC Bonifacio documents her flight from Manila to LA last week. Photo credit: AC Bonifacio's Instagram account


On her Instagram, where she has more than 800,000 followers, she shared a photo of her hanging out with Puth, becoming the envy of his fans as she got to listen to some tracks off "Voicenotes" early. 
"I wasn't able to go to [his] showcase because I was underage (hehe) and Charlie & his team heard about this so they invited us to their villa for a one-on-one with him," she recalled. 
On her interview with Puth, she added: "I can say for sure that he is one of my favorite artists because he’s so humble and down-to-earth!" 


AC Bonifacio's Instagram page


But as if that wasn't enough, Bonifacio also posted photos of her meeting some famous names such as Paris Jackson, daughter of Michael Jackson; singer Bebe Rexha and Jason Mraz. 
It remains unclear how Bonifacio got to meet the mix of singers during her stay in LA. Check out her photos from her fun "workation" below: 









AC Bonifacio with Jason Mraz


AC Bonifacio with Bebe Rexha


AC Bonifacio with Paris Jackson, the daughter of the mate music great Michael Jackson

summary: Saturday's performances didn't exactly wow the judges.
title: Keeping their 'PGT' dream alive: Final batch battle out for grand-finals spots
story:
There are only two spots up for grabs — and without a golden buzzer act to compete for, these "Pilipinas Got Talent" hopefuls perhaps have the best chance to sneak in the grand finals. 
Saturday's episode — the first semis to be held outdoors this season — began with Cebu's Dancing Fire Warriors, a dance group that received a standing ovation for their Battle of Mactan-inspired audition. 

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
This time around, however, the reviews of their similarly fiery performance were more muted, with Vice Ganda noting that they lacked the energy to match their impressive fireworks display. 
Up next was Rico the Magician, or Romarico Sahorjo, who found himself in familiar territory, having competed in the semis of the show's second season. 

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
He made people, including his wife, appear and disappear, which was standard for a magician of his caliber. Vice Ganda even noted that his act was unoriginal, although his trick of pulling a giant snake from a previously empty box did get more than just a few applause. 
"Medyo parang wala akong nakitang hindi ko ine-expect. At this point in the competition, I want to see something we don't expect," Vice Ganda told him. 
Robin Padilla commended Rico for including his family in his act. 
The third performer of the night was Antonio Bathan Jr., whose "kilig"-filled spoken word poetry audition got more than 7 million views online --one of the most-watched this season. 

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
He vowed to make people fall in love with him and his word play act did steal a few hearts --just not those of judges Angel Locsin and Vice Ganda. 
Locsin pointed out that his lines could find its home in romantic movies, although his delivery left her wanting. Vice Ganda felt the same about his act, adding that he failed to live up to their expectations of him given his viral audition. 
"Hindi niyo nasu-sustain iyong first impression namin sa inyo. Hindi ako masyadong kinilig ngayon," Vice Ganda said.
Last up was Angel Fire New Gen, a belly-dancing group. Like with Dancing Fire Warriors, they also used fire as props --and they were better at it, if you asked Vice Ganda. 

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
"Pagdating sa fire dance, mas pasabog iyong pakwitis noong una pero mas gusto ko iyong fire dance na ginawa ninyo," he said. 
Padilla also revealed that they considered Angel Fire New Gen as their "sixth" golden buzzer act, having all agreed to send them to the semifinals without having any debates about it. 
Two more acts are set to take the stage on Sunday's episode, namely the CEBECO II Blue Knights (utility pole dancing) and Jonacris Bandillo (billiards trick master). 
Voting for the viewers will begin after the final two perform, with the top act getting an automatic place in the finals next week. Another will complete the list of finalists via the judges' votes.

summary: Allison Mack was arrested on charges that she recruited women into a secret society in which they were forced to have sex with its leader and were branded with his initials.
title: 'Smallville' actress charged in self-help guru's sex traffic case
story:
Allison Mack, known for her role in the WB Television series "Smallville," was charged with sex trafficking and conspiracy in an indictment unsealed on Friday. Mack, 35, pleaded not guilty at a brief hearing in federal court in Brooklyn before U.S. Magistrate Judge Cheryl Pollak. File/Gus Ruelas, Reuters


NEW YORK—New York actress Allison Mack was arrested Friday on charges that she recruited women into a secret society led by self-help guru Keith Raniere in which they were forced to have sex with Raniere and were branded with his initials.
Mack, known for her role in the WB Television series "Smallville," was charged with sex trafficking and conspiracy in an indictment unsealed on Friday. Mack, 35, pleaded not guilty at a brief hearing in federal court in Brooklyn before U.S. Magistrate Judge Cheryl Pollak.
Pollak declined to release Mack on bail, but said Mack might be released at a future hearing if she could offer "significant property" to secure her bail. A second hearing is scheduled for Monday.
Raniere, 57, was arrested last month and charged with sex trafficking. He is being held without bail.
"The allegations contained in the indictment are only that, allegations," Sean Buckley, a lawyer for Mack', said at Friday's hearing. He declined to comment to reporters outside the courtroom.
U.S. authorities have accused Mack of recruiting women to join what purported to be a female mentorship group but was actually a secret society run by Raniere, the leader of a network of purported self-help groups based in Albany, New York, called Nxivm.
Prosecutors said women recruited into his secret society, who numbered as many as 50, were branded with Raniere's initials, put on extremely restrictive diets to stay thin and forced to have sex with Raniere.
Upon joining, they were required to provide information about family and friends, nude photographs and rights to their assets - so-called collateral used to threaten them if they left, prosecutors said.
The women were taught that the society would empower and strengthen them, according to prosecutors.
Mack helped Raniere control the women in exchange for financial and other benefits from him, prosecutors said.
"Under the guise of female empowerment, she starved women until they fit her co-defendant's sexual ideal, and she targeted vulnerable women," Assistant U.S. Attorney Moira Kim Penza said at Friday's hearing.
On its website, Nxivm calls itself "a community guided by humanitarian principles that seek to empower people and answer important questions about what it means to be human."
In a letter on the site, Raniere said he was "deeply saddened" and denied "abusing, coercing or harming" anyone.
Marc Agnifilo, a lawyer for Raniere, said earlier this month that he was "confident these allegations will be soundly disproven." (Reporting by Brendan Pierson in New York Editing by Leslie Adler)

story:

Isa sa mga sumubok ang working student na si Mark Stephen Cañares. Aniya, okay lang na hindi mapili basta magkaroon ng exposure.

Si Joy naman, todo-hataw sa audition para sa upcoming season ng Pinoy Big Brother (PBB) pero hindi siya pinalad.

"Magaling [ako] magluto, magaling mag-alaga. Sana po Kuya kunin niyo na ako please," paki-usap ni Sugar kay Big Brother. 
Pagdating naman sa mga gustong mag-artista, isa si direk Mae Cruz sa mga kumilatis, habang full support din ang dating PBB housemate na si Joshua Garcia.
"It doesn't mean na parang porke't... guwapo, maganda, 'yun na 'yung ano, may edge na sila. It's the presence that you're looking for," sabi ni Cruz.
"Magpakatotoo lang sila," payo naman ni Garcia. 
Iaanunsiyo ng pamunuan ng Star Hunt sa mga susunod na araw ang mga schedule sa iba't ibang lugar sa bansa.

summary: She's found her 'one and only' and she wants the world to know it.
title: ‘My one and only’: Luis gets sweet tribute from Jessy
story:
She's found her "one and only" and she wants the world to know it. 
Jessy Mendiola marked the birthday of her boyfriend, Luis Manzano, on Saturday with a romantic post, revealing how she considers him to be the "biggest blessing" she has ever received. 
"I thank God everyday for giving me a man who loves me for who I am and supports everything I want to do," she wrote as the caption to a photo of Manzano she shared for her sweet tribute. 
"You take all my fears away," she continued, "and replaced them with hope and happiness. You are a good man, that’s why I'm so LUCKY to be loved by someone like you."
"I love you with all my heart, nothing will ever change that. Happy birthday my one and only howhow!!"



 

A post shared by Jessy Mendiola (@senorita_jessy) on Apr 20, 2018 at 10:07am PDT



Manzano has been with Mendiola since 2016. In February, he opened up about their plans to tie the knot.
Manzano turned a year older this Saturday. He also received a sweet message from her celebrity best friend, Anne Curtis. 



 

A post shared by Anne Curtis (@annecurtissmith) on Apr 21, 2018 at 2:50am PDT



The "It's Showtime" host dug out a photo of Manzano crying at her wedding last year, and wrote: "People may think that you’re always such a joker and 'macho man' (dahil birthday mo lang yan ha) but I’ve seen the caring and soft side of you!"
"Thank you for being my best and only guy best friend! For life ito!" she added. 
This is in addition to the surprise she got from her mother, Batangas Rep. Vilma Santos-Recto.

title: Meet Angelica Panganiban's ‘new love team partner’
story:
She's made up her mind on a love team partner. And surprise, surprise, it's neither JM de Guzman nor Carlo Aquino. 
This Friday, Angelica Panganiban teased fans on Instagram that she has found her new leading man in actor JC Santos. 
"Looking forward to work[ing] with you," she wrote. 



 

A post shared by Angelica Panganiban (@iamangelicap) on Apr 19, 2018 at 2:22pm PDT



It's all in good fun, of course, quipping that both De Guzman and Aquino's set of fans have been driving her crazy lately. 
"Ang gugulo ng mga fans niyo," she joked to the two. "Minura nga nila ko eh. Hahahahaha. Cute naman. Mahal na mahal nila ang mga idol nila. Kaya naman, magmahalan kayo." 
She's referring to the debate fans have been having over who she should be working with next: De Guzman, whom she co-starred with in "That Thing Called Tadhana," or Aquino, her ex-boyfriend. 
Her post with Santos mimicked the near-kiss pose she did with De Guzman a couple of days earlier, which gave the camp siding with the "Araw Gabi" star a slight boost over those cheering for Aquino.

summary: This week should've been one of joy for Kris Aquino.
title: 'I'm not done': Kris Aquino continues to take shots at James Yap
story:
Kris Aquino is not done with publicly criticizing her former husband, James Yap. Photo credit: Aquino and Yap's Instagram accounts


This week should've been one of joy for Kris Aquino. Not to say she isn't happy about celebrating her son's birthday, or about her new movie — it's just that she could've done without the obvious stress that came with fuming at her ex-husband. 
She continued her rant from a day before about James Yap's birthday greeting for their son Bimby — which offended her as she said that it made her look like a bad mother. 
"Did you really think I would back down?" Aquino began her note posted on Instagram Saturday, adding that she wanted to throw up after seeing Yap write things such as he misses his son "every day," he would "always" be there for him, and he'll forever be Bimby's "papa." 



 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Apr 20, 2018 at 11:57pm PDT



Aquino clapped back by pointing out that Yap did not say a single word when their son was publicly bashed for being "baklain" and "lampa." 
"Bullying of an innocent child ang naganap at ikaw walang pakialam na nanahimik --hindi ako magagalit bilang nanay sa pagka-fake ng salita mo?" she asked. 
She also said that she's fine with being the target of all the mudslinging, but know that she will be up in arms if someone drags her kids into the conversation. "Kailan ba ako naglalabas ng galit? Kapag mga anak ko na ang ginagamit at pinagmumukhang may mali sa akin bilang ina," she said. 
"Dahil sabihin niyo na ang lahat BUT MY SONS ARE LIVING PROOF that they are being raised with the love of a warrior queen."
Yap has yet to respond to Aquino's criticisms of him on social media. His latest post showed him taking his motorcycle out for a spin with friends. 



 

A post shared by James Yap (@jamesyap18) on Apr 21, 2018 at 2:02am PDT



Aquino and Yap were married in 2005 but separated 5 years later. Their marriage was annulled in 2012.

summary: Swedish DJ and record producer Avicii, known for his electronic music, was found dead on Friday in Muscat, Oman, his U.S. publicist said.
title: Swedish electronic music DJ Avicii found dead at age 28
story:
Swedish musician, DJ, remixer and record producer Avicii (Tim Bergling) performs at the Summerburst music festival at Ullevi stadium in Gothenburg, Sweden May 30, 2015. Bjorn Larsson Rosvall /TT News Agency/via Reuters/file photo


Swedish DJ and record producer Avicii, known for his electronic music, was found dead on Friday in Muscat, Oman, his U.S. publicist said.
Avicii, whose real name is Tim Bergling, was 28.
"It is with profound sorrow that we announce the loss of Tim Bergling, also known as Avicii. He was found dead in Muscat, Oman this Friday afternoon local time, April 20th," publicist Diana Baron said in a statement on Friday.
"The family is devastated and we ask everyone to please respect their need for privacy in this difficult time," the statement added.
No cause of death was given and Baron said no further statements would be released.

summary: The story, much like the Korean film of the same name, follows an elderly woman who finds a second chance at youth after a visit to a mysterious photo studio.
title: WATCH: First teaser of Sarah G, James Reid's ‘Miss Granny’
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
The first teaser of "Miss Granny" is here, meaning fans now have their first clear idea of how a movie topbilled by Sarah Geronimo and James Reid will shape up since it was announced last year. 
The story, much like the Korean film of the same name it was adapted from, follows Fely (Nova Villa), an elderly woman who finds a second chance at youth after a visit to a mysterious photo studio. 
The first look focuses on the pensioner protagonist, revealing that she's a handful to live with, being a hothead and a control freak. This leads to her daughter-in-law being hospitalized and her son contemplating whether to kick her out of their home. 
It's also hinted that she loves her grandson (James Reid) very much, enough to stand up for his dreams to become a musician. 
The official synopsis adds that Fely will take on a new name after regaining a youthful body, during which she is played by Geronimo, as she "embarks on a quest for happiness." 
There's no release date yet for the Joyce Bernal-directed flick.

summary: The ABS-CBN daytime rom-com shifted gears Friday as Mona (Jodi Sta. Maria) broke down after a harsh realization hit her.
title: Comedy shifts to drama as Jodi breaks down in ‘Sana Dalawa ang Puso’
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
"Sana Dalawa ang Puso," ABS-CBN's daytime rom-com, shifted gears Friday as one of its lead characters, Mona (Jodi Sta. Maria), broke down after a harsh realization about taking the place of her "twin stranger," Lisa (also Sta. Maria).
Struggling to help her family financially, Mona had agreed to Lisa's job offer for a large sum. With identical faces, Mona's task was to pretend to be Lisa, while the latter, a makeup tycoon, finds a way out of an arranged marriage with Martin (Richard Yap).
Lisa believed she could salvage her family's near-bankrupt company by striking a deal with another, instead of following the business deal between her father and Martin's parents.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Unknown to Lisa, Mona has long been Martin's admirer. Expectedly, Mona pretending to be her employer became a romantic trap for the barrio "sabungera." She eventually fell in love with Martin, whose genuine love for Lisa was diverted towards her.
Throughout all this, Mona realized, Martin's affections had been for the woman she was pretending to be, and not her.
Unable to keep her feelings from Lisa's confidant, Kim (Nikki Valdez), Mona was reminded that her job to impersonate her employer was just that, that it was fleeting, and that she could not risk misleading Martin that the actual Lisa can reciprocate his love.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Fitting a wedding dress intended for Lisa, Mona was reduced to tears, admitting she was hurt. She, however, found comforting words from Kim, who told her, "You deserve all the love, and Martin truly deserves someone like you."
With Lisa's pending return, yet to be seen is how Martin will react to her usual cold treatment, after his newfound warm friendship with the "Lisa" portrayed by Mona.

title: Sick of 'half-truths and hypocrisy,' Kris Aquino lashes out at James Yap
story:
Kris Aquino did not hold back in her post criticizing James Yap for suggesting that she's been denying him time with their son, Bimby


She's set to make her big screen comeback in a new movie, her first with Star Cinema since 2015's "All You Need Is Pag-ibig."
But even before she dusts off her acting chops, Kris Aquino has found herself in the middle of some real-life drama. 
In an Instagram post on Thursday, she lashed out at her former husband, basketball player James Yap, for suggesting that she's been keeping their son, Bimby, away from him. 



 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Apr 19, 2018 at 9:19pm PDT



Breaking her "silence," she lambasted Yap for his "half-truths and hypocrisy" after the Rain or Shine star said that he misses his son and told him for his birthday: "I'm always here for you."
"I am ready to be bashed for washing our dirty laundry," Aquino wrote, but added that she "needed" to make a stand for the truth. 
She brought up an incident when Yap supposedly used Bimby for "publicity" for the opening of his bar, and an interview in which he "faked" his emotions over being denied time with their son.
She also criticized Yap for not paying his share of Bimby's tuition, and wondered about why he did not speak up when their son was being bashed for being "baklain." 



 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Mar 13, 2018 at 10:58pm PDT






 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Mar 13, 2018 at 6:20am PDT



"Nanahimik pa rin ako about that," she claimed. "Eh humirit ka with your birthday post." 
"So bakit nga ba hindi kayo nagkikita? Ganito ka simple -- wala ka nang pakinabang kay Bimb. Wala na kasi kaming 'power' so bakit ka pa didikit? Madali kung gusto mo," she said. 
Citing examples, Aquino said that Yap's sibling is able to keep in touch with their helper, and that her sisters, Ballsy and Pinky, are still close with a family "he considers his own" in Iloilo. 
"You are missing out on experiencing what a caring, generous, polite and lovable boy Bimb is -- and it is your LOSS," she said. 



 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Feb 13, 2018 at 9:07pm PST






 

A post shared by Kris C. Aquino (@krisaquino) on Feb 14, 2018 at 1:48am PST



Aquino's post came a day after Yap shared on Instagram a photo of him with Bimby, writing: "Happy birthday Bimb! I miss you and think about you every day."
"Alam ko na ang tagal na nating di nakapag-spend ng time together at di nagkikita, but I want you to know that I'm always here for you. I will always be your papa." 



 

A post shared by James Yap (@jamesyap18) on Apr 19, 2018 at 3:03am PDT



At the sidelines of her contract signing with Star Cinema this Friday afternoon, Aquino was asked about her scathing post. 
She told reporters: "I think that I've said everything that I needed to say. I just felt that I had to speak my truth on behalf of my son. I just feel that if somebody has political ambitions, huwag gamitin ang anak ko to cleanse himself."

summary: Two weeks after the sudden death of Sofia Andres' character, Mayari, in the fantaserye "Bagani," a new hero appears to be in the wings to once again complete the five-member group gifted with legendary powers by the benevolent deity, Apo.
title: 'Bagani': Is this Sofia Andres' replacement?
story:
Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Two weeks after the sudden death of Sofia Andres' character, Mayari, in the fantaserye "Bagani," a new hero appears to be in the wings to once again complete the five-member group gifted with legendary powers by the benevolent deity, Apo.

Death of main 'Bagani' character leaves fans shocked, hoping for twist

In the Star Creatives production, Apo (Deither Ocampo) granted a bond to each bagani with a respective mythical creature, such as Mayari (Andres) with the merman Kataw (Ahron Villena). That bond granted Mayari a magical shield.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
But with her death from being struck with Sarimaw's (Ryan Eigenmann) lightning, Kataw is left without a hero to rear towards defeating the vengeful god and saving Sansinukob.

Goodbye for good? Sofia Andres no longer included in 'Bagani' promo


Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
As of the latest episodes of "Bagani," only Lakas (Enrique Gil) and Dumakulem (Makisig Morales) are actively leading the war against Sarimaw. Ganda (Liza Soberano) remains in Dako Pa Roon, a mysterious place where she awakened after dying in a clash with Sarimaw, while Lakam (Matteo Guidicelli), still possessing the powers of a bagani, has allied himself with the deity.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Struggling in their campaign against Sarimaw, Lakas has recruited a young man who has long dreamed of becoming a bagani himself -- Liksi, portrayed by Zaijan Jaranilla.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Having been separated from his family because of Sarimaw's reign of terror, Liksi commits to Lakas' cause, and immediately starts training under the bagani leader.
Fans who tuned in to the April 19 episode, where Lakas was shown mentoring Liksi, noted that the latter wielded a weapon similar to Mayari's. This triggered speculation that Liksi would eventually become Mayari's replacement.

Watch more in iWantv or TFC.tv
Some, however, pointed out that Liksi is from the same Kalakal (trade) region as Lakam, theorizing that the neophyte warrior would actually replace the Sarimaw-allied bagani, and not Mayari, who represented Laot (sea).
Whether Liksi will indeed become a bagani with Gloria's (Dimples Romana) help is yet to be seen. Also expected to be revealed are how Ganda will manage to reunite with her group, and whether Lakam will decide to stay and help Sarimaw.

In few words, Sofia Andres breaks silence after 'Bagani' exit




 

A post shared by Sofia Andres (@iamsofiaandres) on Apr 10, 2018 at 1:25am PDT



Meanwhile, Andres has set straight rumors that she is transferring networks, as speculated by fans after her abrupt removal from "Bagani." She denied this, adding that she is "proud to be a Kapamilya."

title: Kris Aquino, may bagong movie sa Star Cinema

summary: Muling nagbalik sa ABS-CBN compound si Kris Aquino, dalawang taon matapos nitong lisanin ang network, upang pumirma ng kontrata sa gagawin niyang pelikula sa ilalim ng Star Cinema.
title: Kris Aquino, JoshLia magsasama sa isang pelikula ng Star Cinema
story:
Welcome back, @krisaquino214! pic.twitter.com/Vkweud6rBg
— Shiela Reyes (@shiereyes) April 20, 2018

Muling nagbalik sa ABS-CBN compound si Kris Aquino, halos dalawang taon matapos nitong lisanin ang network, upang pumirma ng kontrata sa gagawin niyang pelikula sa ilalim ng Star Cinema.

THIS JUST IN: Kris Aquino back in ABSCBN compound, set to sign a movie contract with Star Cinema today. pic.twitter.com/6bvtXLWMYZ
— MJ Felipe (@mjfelipe) April 20, 2018

"Tinanong nila ako if I was ready. [I said] yes. Ang tanong ko, are they ready? It feels good. It’s been two years," ani Aquino. 
Makakasama ni Aquino ang Kapamilya love team nina Julia Barretto at Joshua Garcia o "JoshLia" at may working title itong "I Love You Hater." 

The JoshLia-Kris Aquino movie is entitled “I Love You, Hater!” To be directed by Giselle Andres. pic.twitter.com/lHHlkQoQph
— MJ Felipe (@mjfelipe) April 20, 2018

Sa story conference ng pelikula, nagsama-sama sina Aquino, Barretto, Garcia, at ang magiging direktor nila na si Giselle Andres.

Julia apparently sought for Erich’s help to convince Kris to accept the film. pic.twitter.com/3JSk2bpuRb
— Shiela Reyes (@shiereyes) April 20, 2018

Ang huling pelikulang ginawa ni Aquino sa Star Cinema ay "All You Need is Pag-ibig" noong 2015.
Noong nakaraang taon naman nakumpirma na parte siya ng cast sa Hollywood movie adaptation ng librong Crazy Rich Asians ni Kevin Kwan. 

Kris Aquino confirmed to join 'Crazy Rich Asians' cast

Abala ngayon si Aquino sa kaniyang mga food business at online ventures sa pamumuno ng sarili niyang kompaniyang Kris Cojuangco Aquino Productions o KCAP.
Bisitahin ang Patrol.PH para sa iba pang mga balita.

summary: Julia Barretto sought for Erich Gonzales' help to convince Kris Aquino to accept the movie "I Love You, Hater," which will also star Joshua Garcia.
title: How Julia, Joshua feel about working with Kris Aquino
story:
A post shared by Julia Barretto (@juliabarretto) on Apr 20, 2018 at 12:27am PDT



MANILA - Julia Barretto sought for Erich Gonzales' help to convince Kris Aquino to accept the movie "I Love You, Hater," which will also star Joshua Garcia.
Barretto is good friends with Gonzales who, in turn, is close to Aquino.
"Nag-effort talaga ako. When I heard the story, when I heard that they wanted Miss Kris to take it, I texted Erich right away. Sabi ko, 'Please help me na.' Hindi ko na nga sinabi sa Star eh. Dumiretso na lang din ako. We really wanted to work with her for this one," she told ABS-CBN News.
According to Barretto, it is an honor to work with another icon in showbiz following her and Garcia's movie with Sharon Cuneta and Robin Padilla.
"Very blessed kami ni Joshua. We have been given the opportunity to work again with another icon as you would say it. I actually got excited especially when I saw the treatment. I couldn't see anybody else doing her part, her role," she said.
"It's something to look forward to. It fits her so perfectly. We were watching her a while ago. Parang in character na kami lahat."
Meanwhile, Garcia was obviously in awe of Aquino, who he personally met on Friday.
"Masaya lang din ako na makakapagpelikula ulit ako at may makakasama na naman kaming icon. Nahihiya ako kasi noong nagsasalita po siya kanina, sinasabi niya lahat ng mga endorsement niya at achievements niya sa buhay. Ang inspiring niya pero nakakahiya din," he said.
Aquino signed a single motion picture contract with Star Cinema on Friday. Their romantic-comedy film will be directed by Giselle Andres and it is slated to be released on June 13.
